story:
This summer I studied in Italy, and fell in love with the culture, the schooling, and being surrounded so thoroughly with art in my every day life. I am working a full part  as well as school, so that I can go next year, but my projected earnings still fall short of what I need to pay for the program to go abroad. These fundraiser will help me be able to afford to go abroad. 


The $1500 will help pay for the program itself, which is $8700 with Aspect Foundation, I am putting money aside as I work so that I can try and afford this, but it is a little out of the expected amount of money I will have before June. I am asking for help, so that money wont be the reason I can't take on the world and achieve each goal I set for myself.

story:
Instruction Manual for Social Transformation


Have you noticed what people sometimes do when they're not feeling loved:

  • They bully other people,
  • They avoid responsibility for what they've done,
  • They constantly seek attention,
  • They're short-tempered and sulky,
  • They do things that are self-harming,
  • They cause pain and they create drama,
  • They suffer!

LOVE IS THE KEY TO SOCIAL TRANSFORMATION!

I found out, before reaching the age of two that I needed to torment my baby brother. He had to cry so that I could survive. My brother was thirteen months my junior and had come between my mother and I. All of the attention and the affection that I had enjoyed before his arrival had disappeared in an instant.

Loss of connection messes with a toddler’s mind – it has the power to transform that child into someone they should never have become. When the source of my affection got cut off, I remember feeling painfully isolated and abandoned. My perception of isolation was literally killing me. Out of desperation, I conceived a strategy for redirecting her attention and I used that strategy well into my teen years. It involved pestering and bullying my younger brother, until his tears had caused my mother enough distress for her to direct her full attention toward me. When I finally received the attention that I was craving, it wasn’t the kind of attention that I had intended. But, desperate for any attention whatsoever, I preferred my mother’s fury and her punishments to the feeling that I didn’t exist and that I was unworthy of love. I hated my life; I hated my mother; I hated my brother and I hated myself. My life was out of control.

Immersed in hate and self-loathing, I wasn’t particularly pleasant to be around and so my loneliness expanded well beyond our family and into my school and my social life. And the lonelier I felt, the more I hated.

When it eventually came time for me to find a partner, the women attracted to me were women who were accustomed to living in a climate of subdued anger and hate. Knowing that few women would be willing to remain in a relationship with someone as flawed as me, I desperately hung on to my partners. These relationships lasted well beyond their expiry dates and when we finally separated, the fallout felt excruciatingly painful.  There came a point during my thirties when I realised that I wouldn’t survive another heart-rending break-up. The time had come for me to find some way to transmute my hate and a lifetime’s feelings of inadequacy into love, if that was even possible. To thrive, I needed to understand what love is and I needed, more than anything, to learn how to love. So, I embarked on a quest with one singular goal: To learn how to love. My quest brought me into contact with the works of many great teachers and their wisdom then formed the foundation upon which my Learning to Love programs have been constructed.

The more that I learnt about love, the more healthy my romantic relationships became and the Philip who emerged from my quest is a different person from the Philip who started it. As time went by, it became easier for me to, to feel loved and to understand that I am truly worthy of acceptance. The me that emerged has no use for hate and no further need to be a bully. My life rocks. It’s free from drama and I love being the person who I have become.

My healing journey was an arduous one, requiring perseverance and exceptional courage, but not all journeys need to be so difficult. As I progressed through the stages of healing, I started noticing how important it was to feel safe - my biggest transformations were occurring when I could feel 100% safe in my vulnerability. I discovered that the secret to embracing my shameful history and my dark shadow was safety.

Emotional safety unlocks a door to gentle and accelerated personal growth. “Learning to Love – Your Guide to Personal Empowerment”, my new book was carefully written to ensure that no person is ever blamed or made to be wrong – everybody make choices and does things in a particular way for very good reasons, reasons that are rarely apparent to others. Had a few compassionate souls not seen beyond my offensive, bullying behavior and had they not nurtured a tender young boy who was dying of loneliness, then I would still be living a life of pain and isolation today.

“Learning to Love – Your Guide to Personal Empowerment” is based on the lessons in love that I encountered during my quest and on the insights that have flowed from my personal journey of growth and healing. Learning to Love will be available from November, 2015 as an e-book and in print. Please help us to promote Learning to Love and to fund the printing and distribution of this profound healing resource.


Learning to Love - Your Guide to Personal Empowerment!

After completing this book:

  • a reader's three most important relationships are guaranteed to improve,

By promoting this book you could change 10, or more, lives!


Before clicking on play, think of a person you're close to, who grew up in an abusive environment and keep them in mind while you're watching this profound two-minute video clip. It shows the true nature of love. You'll discover that Love's opposite is not hate, but disconnection and isolation. The little girl's name is Maggie.


Maggie began to display signs of severe distress almost immediately, even though her mom was right there. Though we seldom think about it, this kind of separation recurs many times during an average day - every time that a caregiver is forced to ignore a child's needs because they're taking care of someone else's, the child experiences some level of distress. As adults, our nervous system never forgets how terrible that felt and so we do whatever we have to, to avoid disconnection and to secure connection. In adult parlance we talk about "seeking love" and "searching for the ideal soul-mate", a partner who we can count on to always be faithful and attentive.

Notice how Maggie tried every trick in the book to restore the connection with her mom. That willingness, borne out of a need for self-preservation, to do absolutely anything to secure or to restore connection, opens a door, within every one of us, to a lifetime of involuntary emotional abuse and self-betrayal. That's why I consider this experiment to be so important. Maggie is the 'universal child' - Maggie's response to disconnection, mirrors our own vulnerability to disconnection and our need to assure secure, loving connection.

A child's disconnection wound is aggravated by their parents' emotional withdrawal and lack of response - they may be depressed or overwhelmed, stoned, inebriated or distracted by a digital screen, a deadline for work or by financial hardships. When parents and teachers criticize or judge a child, or when they express anger, it re-awakens the child's fear of disconnection. To feel loved, children need to feel a caregiver's unconditional acceptance of them, exactly the way that they are and they need to feel a secure and reliable connection. And, the same is true for adults.

So, I'm wondering, how would the life of that person, who grew up in an abusive environment, be different if they or their parents knew what you've just learned?
 

To understand even more about love, I strongly encourage you to promote this project and to read:

Learning to Love - Your Guide to Personal Empowerment! 

Scheduled for launch in November, 2015.

Author, Lover, Speaker and Workshop Leader, Philip Be'er in Vancouver with Markus Fahrner, Artist, Designer and Co-Author.

A few provocative ideas from 'Learning to Love':

  • Anxiety, depression, conflict and greed are frequently symptoms of insecure connection.
  • Patterns or trauma, dysfunction and addiction are often the result of insecure connection. They get passed unconsciously from parent to child. We now know how to disrupt  these patterns and to heal most of the wounding.
  • Falling in love requires three conditions: unconditional acceptance, secure connection and deep understanding. The first time that we feel judged or criticized by our partner, love gets shattered.
  • The root of almost all conflict can be traced  back to a person's unconscious fear of losing connection.
When Learning to Love hits the shelves in November, it will fundamentally shift the way that anxiety, depression, violence and greed are understood.

Learning to Love offers readers the tools necessary for de-escalating conflicts at every conceivable level.

If we succeed in getting Learning to Love into schools, community groups and into the hands of  social workers and counselors then this book could lead to a reduction in family violence, bullying and suicide.  A 1% reduction in family violence in Canada alone would impact roughly 4400 Canadian families over a 5 year period.

There were just under 88,000 victims of family violence in Canada in 2013, according to police-reported data.

http://www.statcan.gc.ca/daily-quotidien/150115/dq150115a-eng.htm.

story:
Project Based Learning Introduces: Project Prodigy 

An amazing solution to a difficult problem.

Here is the problem:

Home access to computers and the internet has expanded dramatically over the last two decades. However, a surprising number of children are being left behind in their education due to a lack of access to home computers. Without computers at home, the children are often condemned to struggling to keep up with the other children in both essential school studies and the basic computer skills that are becoming necessary to thrive in modern society. Many school tests are now administered on computers, if the student does not have a basic understanding of computers that students test scores can be low. 

They fall behind. 

In the United States, 8% of White children, 26% of Black children and 31% of Hispanic children have no access to a computer at home. Most of these children come from families earning less than $15,000 per year, so their chance of getting a home computer and getting caught up with other students is not good. 

At the same time, millions of older and "out-dated" computers are tucked away in garages, scrapped for metal, or dumped in landfills.

Here is our solution:

Project Based Learning, together with its Space Coast FabLab facility, serves as a community innovation center. Membership is free and individuals of all ages come in to the lab every day to take advantage of the computers, 3D printers and shop equipment offered free of charge and to make prototypes of their ideas and inventions.

Most of the equipment at the FabLab has been donated. It is usually missing pieces to be fully operational by the time we get it, but we have many engineering student volunteers from the Florida Tech's PIKE and APO fraternities who pitch in to rehabilitate donated equipment and make these discarded items into usable tools. Along these lines, we recently received a donation of over 100 used computers from a local business. 

The computers are on average three years old, and each one is missing different parts because the older computers where used as a parts source for some of the newer computers. Some are just basically a box of parts. Others are missing ram, batteries, cords, have failed drives, etc. 

The good news is that each computer has an accompanying monitor, keyboard, mouse and even speakers, making each one a very nice and complete system once the missing pieces are replaced and everything is assembled. 

The goal with Project Prodigy is as follows:

1) Re-fabricate all 100+ computers to include missing parts and update older components that are needed to make the computers run current software.

2) Load each computer with a complete suite of software, including Microsoft Office processing programs.

3) Consult with local school and welfare officials to identify families with school aged children that do not have access to a home computer.

4) Hold free classes for those families including how to set-up, mantain and operate the systems, how to create basic documents and spreadsheets, computer safety and computer security.

5) Upon completion of training, award each participating family a complete computer system.

6) Offer participating families an assortment of continuing software and training classes to allow them to get caught-up with their peers.

This means that over 100 families will be impacted directly and significantly by this project within the next few months. If you think about it, that is a lot of positive change with very visible results.

About Us ....

  • Project Based Learning Inc. (PBL, a Florida Non-Profit) runs Space Coast FabLab and is part of an official chain from the MIT Center of Bits and Atoms. The use of the FabLab (Fabrication Lab) and classroom combination to create a collaborative innovation center offers a truly unique experience in education. Utilizing a project-based approach, PBL offers numerous pathways to STEM education as diverse as the population it serves.

    Participants working to complete a “project” see the math, science, and technology as simple steps toward a personalized goal, instead of a dry textbook or lecture.

    Projects are supported by classroom offerings ranging from children’s snap circuit workshops to advanced FPGA programming and family activities offering the community at large an opportunity to see, feel, and use advanced engineering tools applied to their daily lives. 

    Each month as many as 300 new community members have visited PBL for the first time. Their ages range from 5 yrs. old to early 80s. Their backgrounds and socio-economic standings are just as diverse. The common thread is an excitement about innovation and the desire to achieve the goal of a completed project. 

    It is our intention to expand to over 50 classes, K-12 outreach programs, and Teach-the-Teacher programs, in addition to the normal FabLab activities and family nights. 

    It doesn’t matter what their background is, they’re learning how to find and leverage the knowledge of others and in open/free resources. Students learn to work with other people. A process allowing all levels to contribute to projects. 

    PLB currently offers: 

    -Standard machine shop with CNC machines
    -Video audio capabilities multiple high def. cameras and audio blenders
    -Laser cutters max size 4’ by 2’ cutting size, several smaller 12” laser cutters
    -Standard electrical benches
    -High end computing capabilities (Over 50 PCs)
    -Training rooms (3 current, 7 planned) 
    -DoD level certifications through  pre-existing partnership 
    -An international telecom bridge connecting to all other FabLabs in the MIT network (over 200 locations including MIT)
    -3D printers 

    PBL currently services the community from two separate locations. Over 10,000 students attend school within 3.5 miles of our facilities.  This is combined with current and continued access to tech startup, university students, local engineers, retirees, and the community as a whole.

How To Help

Because we do not charge people for most equipment and facilities use, our budget is rather minimal. That said, we do have a seemingly endless supply of volunteers willing to assist with this and other worthwhile projects. Most are students, some are retirees. Others come in to use the equipment and wind up spending a lot of time on projects and then end up volunteering to help others.

We already have the initial computers, the assembly and repair people, and the volunteer teachers for the basic computer skills classes. The only unfunded  expense is to purchase the parts needed to rehabilitate the computers, software fees, and package the systems safely for their trip home.

The total cost (because we shop wisely) is estimated to be less than $100 per complete system, or approximately $96. That includes replacing some broken monitors and other more expensive pieces.

If funds raised turn out to be less than we need we believe we can come up with the difference for our own volunteers. If not we will distribute as many as we can. If it winds up being more funding than we need, we can expand the program to another 5 or 10 families.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, you can still help!

  • If you live near the Space Coast please come visit us! Volunteer to help clean and assemble units. We will train you and give you free coffee. You will meet some exciting new friends and get to hang around with some really smart engineers. 
  • Please share this project on social media. It's a good project that will be successful because it deserves to be successful. Post this project to your FaceBook page, mention it in your blog if you have one, or use the Indiegogo social media tool to get the word out. We truly appreciate your help.

We hope this will be a long term project.

We hope to expand this program worldwide. It is a bit difficult now, because we do not have the class facilities available in other cities, and the skills training is what makes this project viable. Once we can show others our success we hope to team up with other facilities around the world and make Project Prodigy available just about everywhere. 

It all begins with you.

story:
ABOUT

My name is Le Thi Ha Giang. I am 25 years old, from Ha Tinh, Vietnam. I have graduated from the Faculty of International Relation in Romania and currently I am working in an university in Hanoi, Vietnam.

VISION

Since I was a kid, I had a dream. My dream was that my friends and I  will be able to have access to a better education. Where we would have more chance to play rather than study. Where we would be freely creating our own talent. No judgments, no grades to worry about. No differentiation between rich and poor. The education would  nourish our soul, our mindfulness. 

I have worked hard in my childhood and high school to get the scholarship to go to Romania and studied there for 4 years. During these 4 years, I had the chance to meet many people, make many friends and learn about other cultures. During that time, I just wished that all the Vietnamese youth would also have a chance like me, to go and explore; to learn the things that are not  in the books,  to speak internationally. 

OVERALL PURPOSE: Helping people (especially children and youth) to be able to access a better education. Giving and Receiving. 

OBJECTIVES:

Helping the youth to discover themselves; help them to be confident and can break through their barrier to speak English with people.

Encouraging all the participants to help others, by touching their soul and mindfulness.

SOLUTION:

Solution 1: Establishing a free English hub in Hanoi named Active English Hub, where everyone can come and speak English. We will settle up 01 meeting/week, 01 workshop/week and many other activities such as cultural exchanges or mediation classes. We aim to build a whole country system, to help as many people as we can in the future.


Solution 2: Fundraising to build a road in remote area, for the students and children that live in the area, to be able go to school easier, facing less challenges on their trips. One of the reasons why I do feel lucky,  is the fact that I was born in a poor village. I can see and feel the things that not many rich/city people can. There are many places around the country, where for children/pupils are difficult to travel to school, especially because they don’t have a normal road to go on, thus they need to face with dangerous and difficult situations everyday. Therefore, I would love to fundraise through the  Active English Hub (AEH) and students to build a road for the children and pupils in the remote area. A road of giving and receiving Love. 

TIME: On October 1st 2015, we expect to establish our office for the Active English Hub and start going with the workshop/activities and also fundraising for the road. 

ESTIMATED BUDGET: $20.000

We will spend this money for house renting/electricity expenses, tools to provide better training, transport fee (we have already contacted with some other cities in Vietnam, and AEH will open workshop in another cities as  well). 

FOR YOUR INFORMATION

About Active English Hub: 

It was established in August 2015, and we have already organized 01 workshop about Culture Shock (link: https://www.facebook.com/events/1705862012981562/) and on September, we will do another workshop about “Gratitude and Happiness” (link: https://www.facebook.com/events/1668923629992797/). At AEH, Everyone can meet up and share their thoughts with each others. And everything is free, so we will have no differentiation made  between the poor and the rich. 

Why do people come to AEH?

While our education teaches us about how to be a good student; how to get a high grade; how to be better than someone, Active English Hub would like to share Soul and Mindfulness with people. We believe that the most important thing in life is Happiness and Gratitude. Everyone is human. No one is better than anyone else. We are all equal.

AEH is the place people can get out of their comfort zone and speak English. We are not teacher, because we don’t teach  English. We share our thoughts and experiences with the participants. They talk, we listen and no one is to judge. Because we are all human beings, we make mistakes and we learn from them.

How to contact us?

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Active-English-H...

Website: http://activeenglishhub.com/

Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cu5nTjS5qlc

story:
Don’t engage your little one in a baby talk, sing a song to calm them down

When your little one is distressed, and you don’t know how to make a hitch of it, just sing a song to keep them calm. Most of the parents try to engage their baby in baby talk in order to calm them down. But as per the new studies proves, singing is much better option instead of baby talking.

The study was published in the journal, infancy and it proved that when infants listen to any genre of music, they remain calm for significantly longer time than compared to their state when they are engaged in baby talk. Music leaves a significant impact on humans, physically, mentally and emotionally as well.

The experiment was conducted on 30 healthy infants who were aged between 6 to 9 months. For the first experiment, infants were engaged using baby talk, talking them directly using adult speech, by playing recorded baby talk and then by playing them recorded songs by Turkish singer, the songs were those which they had never heard before. “The performer sang Turkish play songs, not Western ones.

This is an important point as studies have shown that the songs we sing to infants have a specific range of tones and rhythms,” explains first study author Mariève Corbeil, also of the University of Montreal. Earlier studies had already demonstrated that how singing and speech affects the attention of infants. But the recent study has shown that how music affects infant’s emotional self- control.

Let your child hear his own name recited throughout the song with sing a song.

Imagine how a child reacts when they get something of their own on their hand. Sure they will be thrilled with laughter and that laughter will remain for long. What if you can have a way of reciting your child’s name in a children’s song? Yes now you can, with Sing-a-song, give it a try for your child too.

5 years back I came up with the idea of creating a platform especially for children that delivers individual name featured child songs and up to now this effort has facilitated thousands of parents globally to let their children filled with happiness and learn something at the same time. Through this venture I hope to propagate this experience among millions of people and as a startup I’m here on indiegogo.

Sing a Song is the best unique and special gift for child.

We’ve already developed unique and original children’s songs, addressing each child personally, by singing their name throughout the songs. Songs are full with happiness and influence for both children and adults, and contribute to the wonderful atmosphere of joy and family.

Songs list includes:

·  Good Morning - https://goo.gl/oMsWhS

·  Animals Song - https://goo.gl/v0XAtT

·  Learning Letters Song - https://goo.gl/ol4Tr6

·  Learning Numbers Song - https://goo.gl/OdZqE5

·  Happy Birthday Song - https://goo.gl/amnVhJ

·  Happy Birthday dance version - https://goo.gl/7qxvdK

·  Good Night Song - https://goo.gl/HD8EQp

All the lyrics and music are written and composed by professional musicians and academics trained in educational songwriting, and music.


My first music CD is featured with unique and original children’s songs and in each song the singer or the team features the name of the child whom the CD is intended for as a gift.

All the way to bed time these songs are compelling for both children and adults, and contribute to the wonderful atmosphere of joy and family.

What I expect and what you get

The main goal is to collect 20,000 $ at the same time giving you backers the experience of featuring your child’s name into these 7 songs already I’ve worked on. At the same time the funds will go to cover the cost of production of 10 more children songs and I’m super excited to listen to them with you.


Please note that when you order from the sing a song digital album onwards you need to provide me your child’s name to produce the featured songs and those who are willing to order the hard copy version should fill out the shipping details in the delivery segment.


Budget

Here's a projected budget we've prepared to give you an idea as to how we've planned to allocate the funds. (Budget is based on reaching our goal).

Recording Budget

Expenses

Pre Production ($200 a song)

$2,000

Studio Fees

Studio Time

$4,500

Producer Fees

$2,500

Other Workers (engineer, assistants)

$1,500

Tech work

$2,500

After Recording

Mixing Fees

$2,000

Mastering

$2,500

Artwork

$1,500

Exclusive Artwork

$1,500

Grand Total

$18,000

Fundraising Total

$20,000

IndieGoGo Fees (4%)

-$800

Credit Card fees (3%)

-$600

You can buy what fits you most from wide range of perks here.

Other Ways You Can Help

Choose not to make a financial contribution? It’s totally OK. If you feel compelled, there are other ways to support the campaign.

  • Spread the word. Share this campaign on social media, or by word of mouth.
  • Like us on Facebook and Instagram to expand our social reach.
  • Be our premiere member- Send us your thoughts, lyrics etc. to kick start our next song album

We invite you to be a partner of this venture; only together can we make a change and light a new spark in the eyes of the children willing to have something of their own.

All donations are highly appreciated. If our mission interests you please consider posting this page to your friends and family on Twitter, Facebook, colleagues or anyone you think would want to become a part of the revolution of singing for your child. Let's get this journey started, together.

story:
MERRY CHRISTMAS and HAPPY NEW YEAR 2016!!!

May you and your family and our every respected Contributor be blessed with, Good health, Happiness and Prosperity, 

Merry Christmas! 

And a Very Happy New Year 2016!

- Himalaya Mt. Everest Tower Organization Family 

 Kathmandu, Nepal

DEAR GREATLY RESPECTED, 

We're so grateful and proud that you've heard our plead to get food for lost CHILDREN of NEPAL on DEC 25th, 2015. I on behalf of our HIMET Organization Family heartily 'THANK YOU from the buttom of the HEART!' If you've not sent your POSTAL ADDRESS please send to info@mounteveresttower.org, info@mission2nepal.org or mounteveresttower@gmail.com. We'll update to you all in details with photographs and videos of thanking from the children after food along with mentioned perk/products in timely manner.

May God return you thousands folds from His every Heavenly doors!!!

Yours in good faith,

Founder, Chair, Director

Rajendra Nhisutu

Kathmandu, Nepal

HI, Greetings with a Beacon of NEW LIGHT and LOVE from the TOP OF THE WORLD MT. EVEREST, NEPAL!This is Rajendra Nhisutu I am a local resident of Kathmandu (Capital of Nepal) I have served a few years as a Mission Coordinator around the Asian countries.  And since 2011 we have been serving with local community that combines the breathtaking beauty of the World Top Mountains with the desire to make a positive difference in people. NEPAL EARTHQUAKE and CRITICAL SITUATION OF CHILDREN

Nepal is in between China and India which is a severely food deficit country struggling to recover from a 10-year Civil War. With a GDP per capita of $ 470, Nepal is the poorest country in South Asia.

Nepal earthquake 25th April and May 12th, 2015 twice 7.9 R/scales and thousands times aftershocks, the worst in the last 80 years , has caused massive destruction to lives affecting at least 2.8 million children, of which 9,40,000 are in need of aid. And around 9000 people lost their lives, 35,000  were injured and over 500,000 houses were destroyed in the deadly quake and its subsequent aftershocks. 

Over 900,000 (Nine hundred thousand) Children of Nepal need Immediate help with Food, Clothing, Medicine and Clean Water.

And aftershocks have been keep occurring most often daily yet. Please Check out: http://www.seismonepal.gov.np

 WHY THIS CAMPAIGN FOR?

This Campaign is for humanitarian APPEAL to help feeding for Orphans and Destitute Children of Nepal who are earthquake, landslides survivors and victim during civil war in Nepal.

Every year on Dec 25th we have been feeding in the open ground and this time we're planning to feed in two groups in two places there will be minimum 900 (Nine hundreds) children from both group. 

WHAT WE NEED 

'We are seeking financial help to manage FOOD SUPPLY and our required budget for 900 children to feed and manage some clothes and shoes for neediest are minimum USD $ 4,200 (Four thousand and two hundred)'.Please help us whatever you can – no donation is too small, every dollar is a step closer to reaching our funding goal.

In lieu of funds, other in-kind support is desperately needed (i.e. warm clothing such as children's winter jackets, clothing, thermals and socks, shoes).

The children are aged from early childhood to secondary level.

HOW YOU CAN HELP

By choosing one (or more) of the perks you help to manage food supply, clothes and volunteers tips. Just go to the Sidebar Right side and click directly on the product/perk you want.

WHAT YOU GET

All perks are locally hand crafted in Kathmandu, Nepal from e-gifts to precious items, to suit all budgets.  

The options include World Top Greetings Card with your name and photo printed, Top of the World Certificate of Honour, Mt. Everest Embroidery T Shirt, Himalayan precious handicrafts.

Sent with love from the highest planet on the Earth.OUR MISSION TEAM:

We are wholehearted and spirit leaded willing to do something good in the neediest society by joining with like-minded people like you from Kathmandu valley to the most remote parts of Nepal. 

And we have been making meaningful differences in the lives of downtrodden, under privileged and heterogeneous community groups of Nepal where earthquake survivors and victim of orphaned and distressed children during the past ten years of Civil War in Nepal.

HIMET assists with the health, welfare and education, of orphans, the destitute, at-risk, and children dying from AIDS those suffering problems caused by a decade of civil war, famine, persecutions and natural disasters.

Hence, this our Himalaya Mt. Everest Tower Organization 'HIMET' heartily requests help to feed whole day full stomach food for 900 Orphaned and Vulnerable Destitute Children of Nepal, on December 25, 2015 (Northern Winter). 

The requirement budget for feeding is USD $ 4,200 (Four thousand and two hundred).

"Your Co-operation toward this Nobel Cause Bring 

 New Happiness and Revival for Earthquake Survivors 

and Wounded Orphaned and Destitute Children of Nepal"

Tele-meetings can be arranged via Skype.

Yours in good faith,

Founder, Chair, Director

Rajendra Nhisutu
Himalayan Mount Everest Tower Organization (HIMET)
Email: mounteveresttower@gmail.com,

https://np.linkedin.com/in/rajendranhisutu

For general queries, sponsorship or donation enquiries, I am contactable direct via: mounteveresttower@gmail.com or

info@mission2nepal.org, info@mounteveresttower.org.np or on Cell.

Tel: +977 9843097740, +977 1 4275636 Skype: nhisutu, Twitter: Mission2Nepal

Our Education Supports for Orphaned and Destitute Children of Nepal: 

http://www.mounteveresttower.org.np/gallery-01-3

http://www.mounteveresttower.org.np/gallery-03-2015

http://www.mission2nepal.org/gallery-01-2015

http://www.mission2nepal.org/gallery-03-2015

Our Nepal Earthquke Relief Efforts:

http://www.mounteveresttower.org.np/emegency-relief-effort

http://www.mounteveresttower.org.np/gallery-02

http://www.mounteveresttower.org.np/gallery-03-2015

http://www.mission2nepal.org/gallery-02-2015

http://www.mission2nepal.org/earthquake-relief-effort-and-lost-children

http://www.mission2nepal.org/emergency-relief-effort

Websites: 

http://www.mounteveresttower.org.np/orphaned-and-destitute-children-of-nepal/

http://www.mission2nepal.org


Clothing can be posted to the HIMET P.O. Box as per below. 

To: HIMET
Attn.: R. Nhisutu
Zip/PostalCode: 44600, Govt. Post Office Box No.: 5020

Kathmandu, Nepal

 
Critical situation in Nepal is already almost 05 months please check out; 

HUMANITARIAN CRISIS IN NEPAL

story:
Sea Scout Ship 243 has been a part of Sea Scouting since the mid 1950s. We have focused on teaching young men and women the skills necessary to operate a boat in a safe manner and teach the values of Sea Scouting. We do this onboard our training vessel Sea Horse, a 65-foot former Navy patrol boat. Our program is growing but at this time we need to raise funds for a haul out and hull survey necessary to upgrade our liability insurance. This is an amazing program giving young adults a chance to learn something they might never have access to. Not only do they learn how to operate the boat they get to travel as well.  They learn boat maintenance, piloting and navigation along with many other skills. Many of our past crew members have gone on to have careers in the military and the maritime trades. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need  to tackle several items in order to make this project a success. 

  1. The boat needs to be hauled out of the water
  2. Power wash the bottom and inspect the hull
  3. The hull need to be gauged and surveyed
  4. Perform any hull repairs as required
  5. Prime and paint the bottom of the boat
  6. Inspect the propellers and rebalance if necessary 
  7. Inspect shaft packing and bearing and repair as needed
  8. Replace zincs as needed

Donations of needed materials will also help with this project.  Items that we could use include bottom and topside paint for an aluminum boat. 

All repairs will be done depending on the amount raised through this campaign. Naturally the more donated the more work can be done. Any funds left over will be used to further improve the Sea Horse. We are in need of a generator as well as updated electronics.  

Perks include Sea Horse / Ship 243 hats and t-shirts!

The Impact

Ship 243 can continue our program with confidence that our boat is ready for the challenge . If you cant donate at this time we completely understand.  Just sharing this campaign among your friends and asking them to do the same can help us reach our goal. If you posses the skills need to help us with this we can certainly use the help too . Every little bit helps . Thank you for taking the time to read about our project.

Other Ways You Can Help

 If you can't donate at this time we completely understand.  Just sharing this campaign among you friends and asking them to do the same can help us reach our goal. if you posses the skills need to help us with this we can certainly use the help too . Every little bit helps  thank you for taking the time to read about our project. you can find out more information sea Scout Ship 243 and the Sea Horse on our Facebook page  Sea Scout Ship 243 " Sea Horse " Rahway NJ

story:
My Inspiration:

I am a young Entrepreneur from India passionate about building solutions which could prevent food wastage and create food sustainability.A dream to have a World without Hunger.

After my bachelor's in engineering, I took up a consulting job at Knight Frank, which largely involved consulting for large companies to set up their factories in India.Post which, I started an online jewellery venture along with my wife, with a mission to make jewellery shopping easy.

I always felt that I should be solving problems which are large and essential to the humanity.

At home, I used to see several perishable ingredients like fruits, vegetable, milk products, biscuits, confectionery products being thrown into the bin. This was largely due to non-utilisation or either it would have surpassed the expiry date.  

I started to think if i was wasting so much food at home, what would be happening at the Global level.Hence,I started to read about the food wastage that exists in the World and i was baffled !

Take a look at this:


(Source: FAO)



The food wastage does not end only with this, but also generates greenhouse gases,wastage of large amounts of natural resources like water and also an enormous amount of labour.

(Source: FAO)

This is a very serious issue and calls for us to take measures to save and consume food in more responsible way.

This calls for innovation and entrepreneurs to come up with solutions to reduce food wastage.

More information on food wastage. Click Here


IGNITE 2016:

I have been selected to attend IGNITE which is a week long program starting on July 10th 2016 conducted by The University Of Cambridge. The program has a comprise blend of practical teaching sessions, expert clinics, mentor sessions and experienced advice and support from leading entrepreneurs and innovators, it will give me the tools, contacts, and confidence to transform my ideas into reality. More about IGNITE

By attending this program, it will empower me with the right tools, skills and network to build & develop products which would help me realise my dream of "Zero Food Wastage" . IGNITE, also  offers intense training to build critical skills . People who teach at IGNITE are experts from the industry, successful entrepreneurs, and VCs which enables tremendous hands-on learning.Tailored support through mentoring and clinics provide expert advice on individual business ideas and specific issues such as investment readiness, technical and market due diligence.
I am looking at networking & creating awareness with other entrepreneurs, who are coming from more than 27 countries to come with ideas & solution for the food wastage issue.

Smart Chef

Was launched early June of 2016. Smart Chef makes cooking smart. It suggests recipes based on the available ingredients.Hence, provides effective utilisation of ingredients. Currently, the android based app is released download it here. 

Your feedback and suggestion would help us solve the problem.Love to hear your feedback on this.


What I Need:

Breakup of the total funding I need is below:

Tuition: $1724
Travel: $1150
Living Expenses: $698
Discount: $172

Amount to be raised: $ 3400

Even if I do not reach the entire goal, all the funds raised here would be used to fund my tuition and travel to participate in IGNITE at The University of Cambridge.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please do not waste food. Cook and eat smartly.Create awareness about food wastage among your family and friends.
  • Download the app and provide us your valuable feedback.
  • Join us in achieve zero food wastage, share us your thoughts and ideas
  • Please help me get the word out about this campaign in your network.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Lastly, Thank you for the share.

story:
Lichen Life Labs is a working vision for a Self Funding Community Lab in the trendy little town of New Cumberland Pennsylvania sitting on the crux of I-83 and The PA turnpike making it extremely accessible to people in The DMV, New Jersey, New York, and Ohio! 

Some of the Functions of Lichen Life Labs

  • Open 5 Days a week offering free education, affordable rental sterile space, certified kitchen, and access to equipment.  
  •  Maintain cultures of Bacteria, Algae, and Fungi from the Susquehanna Valley, Local Appalachian Mountains, and from sample brought in.
  • Offer Low Cost Cultures of Fungi(Mushrooms), Algae, and Insects
  • Affordable Water & Soil analysis 
  • DNA Sequencing
  • Workspace for Local Businesses 
  • Hub for Citizen Science & Bio Hacking
  • Platform for Local Educators
  • Community Outreach & School Tours
The Ball is Rolling
We already operate a basic microbiology lab equipped with Flow Hood, Bacticinerator, Microscope and Refrigerator.
New Cumberland has many Great Locations for Lichen Life Labs, we will Operate out of tandem Garage Spaces accessible to us until we need to expand further. 

What We Need 


Bacteria/Algae/ Fungi Culturing Equipment 
Petri Dishes, Scalpels, Inoculation Loops, Syringes, Syringe Filters, Jars, Flasks, etc.
Molecular Biology Lab Kit, Micro Centrifuge & CRISPR kits from The ODIN

Lab Glass Set / Soxhlet Extractors/ Evaporator Flasks / Seperatory Funnel / Distillation Units/ Oil Press / Centrifuge / Vacuum pump 

Tables / Stools

Main Computer/ Raspberry pis/ Arduino Boards 

Stereoscope/ USB scope / Projector 

Official State Inspected Scale/ Deli Slicer/ Dehydrator

Project Funding



 What You Get
Cordyceps Mushroom Sticker without Watermark

Reishi Mushroom Shirt


The Impact

I had to work out of a small box until I could afford the equipment to build out my lab, I want to ensure affordable access to equipment necessary to work effectively with emerging DIY sciences like mycology, phycology, and genetic engineering.

To avoid debt in furthering my education I  had/have to travel all around the United States, mostly to the West Coast to learn various Sciences outside of Universities, and Institutions. Lichen Life Lab will serve as hub for Citizen Science and Education in a highly accessible area on the East Coast.

About Me

Hello My name is William Padilla-Brown, I am a Social Entrepreneur, Educator, and Certified Permaculture Designer among many other things. I have a passion for understanding that led me to building out a laboratory in the spare bedroom of my home to begin playing with fungi, and algae. Over the past 5 years I have been taking part in educational programs, and educating my self in various fields of Science.  I have educated over 200 people directly in the past 2 years through events I hosted & participated in. My quest for knowledge took me all over the United States, I feel now it is my responsibility to Share what I know where I am!

story:
A good friend of mine, dian marino, was fond of saying “be passionately aware that you could be completely wrong.”  This radical statement of humility about what we know has guided me infall aspects of my life, from activism, to popular education, to parenting. And 13th Century Sufi teacher Saadi of Shiraz said, “none learned the art of archery from me who, in the end, did not make me the target.” Another radical statement that guides me daily. Having spent over 30 years seeking, learning, and practicing popular education I have a few things to commit to paper. Popular education challenges our certainties and helps us work with each other to create the new certainties that we need to change our world in this dire time. I plan to complete an important book that combines knowledge of popular education with storytelling and, crucially, what i have learned from trickster traditions around the world. It is these trickster traditions that hold the missing key to our efforts to learn better, to effect better change in our lives and the world. And it is urgent that we do so.

Much is made of innovation as the solution to contemporary problems. And the trickster, in teaching us how to think creatively, has obvious relevance in this. But the trickster also teaches us how to rediscover, preserve, and, possibly, reinvent old ways that are also important sources of solutions to the troubles we face - troubles that we have often created ourselves. The trickster teaches us both daring and humility. And much of this is through storytelling - something that i have developed as an important aspect of popular education.

I have been involved in the world of popular education since the late 70s and have been privileged to be able to learn from great educators and theorists around the world. And, while i have produced many resources (articles in books, ‘zines, reports, curricula) my commitment always to be on the front-line of this work, rooted primarily in  community-based work, has made consolidating my knowledge in a book an elusive goal. I am waiting no longer. This project, “Praxis: A Trickster’s Guide to Popular Education” will bring together the key elements of popular education as i have come to see and practice them today.  

Popular education is a process of social change rooted in the realization that learning is a fundamental part of change. Inspired by the work of Brazilian educational philosopher Paulo Freire, I am one of thousands of people around the world who have developed and practiced popular education as a means of resisting oppression by  supporting people and communities to build capacities, often already nascent, to transform their world for the better. Combining my skills in journalism, community art, storytelling, and puppetry has allowed me to explore and develop dimensions of popular education and social change that remain both unrepresented and under-represented in the literature available to educators and activists for social change. Since 2001 i have taught a graduate class in popular education (co-taught in the first two years) at the Faculty of Environmental Studies at York University. This class, Popular Education for Social Change has been a place to hone both practice and theory, share it with hundreds of students, and amass a library of resources both theoretical and practical. I have shared my knowledge through various writing projects including working on the collection of dian marino’s writings Wild Garden: art, education, and the culture of resistance (Between the Lines, 1997), publishing a blog about storytelling and popular education Comeuppance, co-founding the Catalyst Centre, a popular education worker co-op, and more.

 “Praxis: A Trickster’s Guide to Popular Education”  has four components:

  1. Core aspects of a theory of popular education (5-6 chapters) example here
  2. A Collection of illustrated activity descriptions of popular education methods (between 20 and 30) example here
  3. Case studies of popular education projects (4-5) - example here
  4. A collection of Wisdom Tales (30-40) - examples here

A key dimension of popular education is the way in which it combines theory and practice. But articulating this (in print and otherwise) is a significant challenge given the dominant practices of knowledge-making which take for granted that theory and practice can be separated. My practice or, more accurately, praxis, has always combined a vigorous interest in theory and a rigorous application of various methods in contexts of learning and social change. As a student of Paulo Freire’s work, i took to heart a long time ago this challenge to realize this praxis (this combining of theory and practice). This book will share my successes as well as examples of what i have researched from around the world.

Finally, i believe one of my most powerful realizations about popular education has to do with the nature of play and playfulness - thus my use of the term “trickster” which combines notions of play and risk. Popular education praxis recognizes that being playful is more than mere fun - it is a radical obligation. This is not about play as frivolity and amusement but play as structured risk-taking that includes the way all children learn the fundamentals of participation in human culture - we’ve all been through it and yet, so much of our upbringing and education then becomes about avoiding risk. The trickster, a figure found universally in human cultures, is the neglected teacher of how to meet and engage risk.

One of my favourite trickster stories, and a key inspiration for this project is:

One day a devoted Talmudic student ran out of the synagogue shouting, “What is the meaning of life? What is the meaning of life?” He ran through the streets shouting all the while. He found himself before the house of his Rabbi. He went inside and, almost in tears, pleaded, “What is the meaning of life, master?” The rabbi slapped the student across the face. “Why did you hit me,” asked the startled student. The rabbi answered: “Such a good question. And you want to exchange it for an answer? It is the answers that keep us apart. It is the questions that unite us!”

(You'll find 8 short pieces of me waxing on about stories at the Biology of Story.) 

This will be a book about the posing of questions. The chapters on theory, the activity descriptions, the stories … all these will be tools with which to pose the unique questions relevant to those readers who wish to improve their practice. My goal is to help people and communities see what they already have and what they are already doing that is making a positive difference in the world and to offer more choices about what can be done. Not only “tricks of the trade,” as important as these are (and there will be lots of these), my goal is to fan the flames of creativity found in all people and communities so that together we will bring into existence the “better possible world” heralded by activists for environmental and social justice around the world.

What We Need & What You Get

My budget for this project is simple, i am seeking to pay for my time to write. My expenses are two-fold, rent and groceries. As important as this book is, my priority is the care and well-being of my two children. They are the most demanding and rewarding events in my life. But being separated, i have been a virtual single parent (having been the primary care giver for over two years now) and the one thing i do not have is time to write. Thus this project campaign. My $20,000 goal will allow me to devote the equivalent of half my work time to this project for which i am to have a  completed manuscript by January 2017. Fulfilling the perks will cost about 15% of the money raised.

The rewards i am offering for the support you may offer are a combination of the art work and writing (‘zines and artist books) that i have produced in my work of popular education, the finished book itself, of course, and, for those who donate $1000 or more, a popular education fluxus box (a vintage suitcase filled with ‘zines, art supplies, games, and more - all of which can be used in work with groups - it’s a group facilitator’s tickle trunk). 

Risks and Challenges

This is a low risk project. I will use whatever funds are raised regardless of meeting the target. Success will mean completing the book on schedule. Failing to meet the target means slower progress, but progress nonetheless. I have completed more funded projects in my career as a popular educator than I can count.

Other Ways You Can Help

If contributing financially is a challenge then please consider helping to spread the word about this campaign. A good word sent our to your networks can be a huge assist. Indiegogo has tools for sharing - check them out. And, of course, keep your ear to the ground for the release of the book in the not-too-distant future.

But articulating this (in print and otherwise) is a significant challenge given the dominant practices of knowledge-making which take for granted that theory and practice can be separated. As a student of Paulo Freire’s work, i took to heart a long time ago this challenge to realize this praxis (this combining of theory and practice). This book will share my successes as well as examples of what i have researched from around the world.
Finally, i believe one of my most powerful realizations about popular education has to do with the nature of play and playfulness - thus my use of the term “trickster” which combines notions of play and risk. Popular education praxis recognizes that being playful is more than mere fun - it is a radical obligation. This is not about play as frivolity and amusement but play as structured risk-taking that includes the way all children learn the fundamentals of participation in human culture - we’ve all been through it and yet, so much of our upbringing and education then becomes about avoiding risk. The trickster, a figure found universally in human cultures, is the neglected teacher of how to meet and engage risk.
One of my favourite trickster stories, and a key inspiration for this project is:
One day a devoted Talmudic student ran out of the synagogue shouting, “What is the meaning of life? What is the meaning of life?” He ran through the streets shouting all the while. He found himself before the house of his Rabbi. He went inside and, almost in tears, pleaded, “What is the meaning of life, master?” The rabbi slapped the student across the face. “Why did you hit me,” asked the startled student. The rabbi answered: “Such a good question. And you want to exchange it for an answer? It is the answers that keep us apart. It is the questions that unite us!”(You'll find 8 short pieces of me waxing on about stories at the Biology of Story.) This will be a book about the posing of questions. The chapters on theory, the activity descriptions, the stories … all these will be tools with which to pose the unique questions relevant to those readers who wish to improve their practice. My goal is to help people and communities see what they already have and what they are already doing that is making a positive difference in the world and to offer more choices about what can be done. Not only “tricks of the trade,” as important as these are (and there will be lots of these), my goal is to fan the flames of creativity found in all people and communities so that together we will bring into existence the “better possible world” heralded by activists for environmental and social justice around the world.
What We Need & What You GetMy budget for this project is simple, i am seeking to pay for my time to write. My expenses are two-fold, rent and groceries. As important as this book is, my priority is the care and well-being of my two children. They are the most demanding and rewarding events in my life. But being separated, i have been a virtual single parent (having been the primary care giver for over two years now) and the one thing i do not have is time to write. Thus this project campaign. My $20,000 goal will allow me to devote the equivalent of half my work time to this project for which i am to have a  completed manuscript by January 2017. Fulfilling the perks will cost about 15% of the money raised.
The rewards i am offering for the support you may offer are a combination of the art work and writing (‘zines and artist books) that i have produced in my work of popular education, the finished book itself, of course, and, for those who donate $1000 or more, a popular education fluxus box (a vintage suitcase filled with ‘zines, art supplies, games, and more - all of which can be used in work with groups - it’s a group facilitator’s tickle trunk). 
Risks and ChallengesThis is a low risk project. I will use whatever funds are raised regardless of meeting the target. Success will mean completing the book on schedule. Failing to meet the target means slower progress, but progress nonetheless. I have completed more funded projects in my career as a popular educator than I can count.
Other Ways You Can HelpIf contributing financially is a challenge then please consider helping to spread the word about this campaign. A good word sent our to your networks can be a huge assist. Indiegogo has tools for sharing - check them out. And, of course, keep your ear to the ground for the release of the book in the not-too-distant future.

story:
Please take the time to meet Honey Beehive Childcare's owners Candace Robinson and Ja'Lisa Wilkins.  

My name is Candace Robinson, I am the mother of two young children and an experienced early childhood educator.  After spending 6 years working in multiple childcare centers and a home daycare, I began to seek the best fit for me.  With the suggestions of many family and friends, I realized the best fit was my own facility.

My Name is Ja'Lisa Wilkins, I am also an experienced childcare educator. I've been working with children since 2008 whether it was in a daycare to a school setting I've done it all. I've always had a dream of becoming my own boss while pursuing my passion to work with children as well. So why not put those two together by starting my own daycare! See when I was younger I did not enjoy daycare at all! Teachers weren't as attentive and at times unfair but hey that could have been just been the POV of my 5 year old self! What I really do remember is my Aunt Macy coming to pick me up and we had the best times together. She taught me so much from manners to how to stand up for myself and be bold, she taught me how to treat others the way I would like to be treated, be respectful to my elders and that we all make mistakes you just pick yourself up and learn from them. All while having fun in the process of these lessons. 
 

To pursue this passion, we partnered together and started Honey Beehive babysitting service in  Candace's home to build clientele.  The overwhelming support and demand for a trusted  affordable care flourished quicker than we anticipated requiring  additional funds for expansion, assistance, and equipment .

 

We are eager to provide parents with cutting edge childcare without the costly price tag.

Quality affordable care that supplies:

  • Flexibility
  • Early learning materials  for all ages that exercise all  5 senses, discovery & individuality
  • Latest technology for increased security, communication & safety
  •  The comfort of a home, structure of a facility & love of family

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

We need:

  •  DCFS approved facility licensed for 80 children
  • Qualified staff
  • 5 furnished classrooms
  • Fully operable kitchen
  • Age appropriate toys and materials
  • Deposits for facility and utilities
  • Funds for advertising

 

According to smallbusinesschron.com, Forbes reveals that the equipment and supplies can cost between $300 to $400 per child and taking over an existing facility can run at least $30,000. Selfhelp.org reports the cost of educational supplies to total up to $4,100 and averaged the total start up cost for a new facility to be$ 83,030. We currently have $10,000 between us and  seeking funding for $25,000 to take over an existing facility or put towards a new facility to open Honey Beehive Childcare.

 

What you get:

  • "The BUZZ"

"Thank You" via social media & Grand Opening details with pictures of facility via email

 

  •  "Simply Sweet"

"Thank You" via social media, Grand Opening details with pictures of facility via email , handmade "Thank You" card & bookmark via mail

 

  • "Beehive Guest "

"Thank You" via social media, Grand Opening details with pictures of facility via email, chance to win Edible arrangement (valued @ $100), Early access to waiting list &

- A walk through an IEP with an educator who possess a Masters in Special Education face to face within and surrounding the west suburban area or via email anywhere OR

- PC virus removal by a certified technician within and surrounding the west suburban area

 

  • "Honey Bee Special"

"Thank You" via social media, Grand Opening details with pictures of facility via email, chance to win Edible arrangement (valued @ $100), Early access to waiting list, 50% off one weeks tuition for one child or 25% off for two or more children upon enrollment & sponsorship recognition on our website

 

  • "Royal Treatment"

"Thank You" via social media, Grand Opening details with pictures of facility via email , handmade "Thank You" card and bookmark via mail, exclusive t-shirt, assortment of gift cards (valued at $20), plus recognition on website and name tile on wall of sponsors in facility.

 

**If we do not reach our goal of $25,000 all donations will be used toward start-up cost of the facility. A raffle ticket number will be emailed for the chance to win offer.**

 

THE IMPACT

 

One of the biggest reasons childcare is unaffordable for some people is because the  business open its doors deep in long term debt. This forces the establishment to have high prices that will allow them to pay off debt and afford day to day operations. With your help we're hoping to raise enough funds for start up to keep our long term debt as low as possible. This will allow us to keep our prices 10 to 15% less than our surrounding competitors and provide quality services without the high price tag.

 

RISK & CHALLENGES

 

According to smallbusinesschron.com, Daycare business risk and challenges include:

  • Keeping small children healthy
  • Creating and maintaining open communication and trust among staff and parents
  • Complying with licensure requirements
  • Qualified staff
  • Educational value in toys
  • Fully understanding and properly reporting incidents

 

Our solutions:

  • Firm & apprehensible sick policy, visual check for obvious signs of illness upon arrival and sanitation of toys and equipment every other day versus weekly
  • Communicate daily, weekly and host monthly family events
  • Create checklist of requirements to be used every 3mths
  • Offer continuing education credit to employees in addition to on-site training
  • Invest in quality toys
  • Firm & apprehensible reporting policy

 

Other ways you can help

 

Money isn't always everything and any donation of these items are greatly appreciated:

  • Use Indiegogo sharing tool to create a BUZZ about our campaign!!!!
  • Advice and insight from other childcare providers & entrepreneurs
  • Information about other resources that will aid us in reaching our goal
  • Leads on existing childcare facilities within Cook County, IL for sale
  • Advice on anything you think will be helpful to the us

Invest in quality toys
Firm & apprehensible reporting policy

Money isn't always everything and any donation of these items are greatly appreciated:

Use Indiegogo sharing tool to create a BUZZ about our campaign!!!!
Advice and insight from other childcare providers & entrepreneurs

story:
Help Africans acquire computer skills and receive assistance to launch their Startup, create value and jobs in their countries - French Silicon Academy


Our main objective is to provide less developed African countries with a high quality education, and help from specialised teachers worldwide.

We want to allow 50 000 Africans to enroll in online computer science courses and obtain a certificate. We will offer help in launching entrepreneurial projects and setting up crowdfunding. We aim to create employment and foster digital entrepreneurship for those who need it the most. We foresee not only the creation of jobs and value in this region, but also the emergence of great businesses, that will make a real impact.


What we want to change:

How the French Silicon Academy works:


How we will use this money:

Why our education costs $5 per student:

So, every dollar you donate will be used to provide high quality courses and education to less developed countries in Africa. 

  • If we reach 100 000$ we will send 5,000 FSA textbooks to middle schools in Africa.
  • If we reach 200 000$ we will send 15 000 FSA textbooks to middle schools in Africa.
  • If we reach 300 000$ we will send 30 000 FSA textbooks to middle schools in Africa.
  • If we reach 500 000$ we will open an FSA School in Senegal.


    • Beyond money, we need your help spreading the word:

    Here are 5 ways you can play a significant role in the success of the French Silicon

    Academy:

    1. Contribute! - a great place to start is to buy one of our awesome perks. Scroll down to find out more!

    2. Join FSA - Join the FSA for a chance to learn new skills, join coding discussions and get feedback on your startup and project ideas.

    3. Launch your project on our crowd-funding platform - head over to our crowd-funding page and upload a presentation of your project for the chance to receive support in raising your own funds. Find out more on how to get started on our FAQ page!

    4. Share and refer friends to FSA - Help us spread the word. You can find us on Facebook and twitter too!

    5. Create and Share Digital Content - we are encouraging everyone, with plenty or no coding experience, to create content that will spread the word about our coding education.


    Remember, if you have any questions, please visit https://frenchsiliconacademy.com/contact to ask your question. We would love to hear from you and will get back to you as soon as we can.

story:
With our goal of $12,000, we will buy novels for grades KG-12, build our school library, and expand our book collection to meet the needs of our growing student body, who read books faster than we can get them!

Our School

The American International School in Gaza (AISG). AISG is the only international school in Gaza that teaches the American curriculum and it strives to promote an understanding and appreciation of the world's diverse cultures. We are an independent, co-educational K-12 school, which offers an American curriculum leading to the American High School Diploma. Our education philosophy emphasizes academic excellence and rigor in a supportive school and family environment. We aim to prepare a diverse student body for higher education; to inspire our youth to realize their potential; to foster life-long learning, tolerance, peace, personal integrity, and democratic values; and to prepare our students to become responsible adults, with respect for different cultures and beliefs. AISG graduates are currently pursuing their university studies in the most reputable universities in the Middle East, Europe and North America.

Despite the tragedy of the school facilities destruction on January 3, 2009, AISG is still committed and continued providing quality educational services to its students.

AISG offers an ideal avenue for serving the international’s community goals for Gaza and investing in the future of Gaza and its people.  The realization of the school’s vision as a US-accredited school providing a high quality American and international education to children in Gaza would have a tremendous impact on Gaza’s economic and cultural development, and will be able to be a force for peace and sustainability in the middle east through nonviolent means and principals of tolerance and coexistence.

In spite of political, economic, and security situations that are unimaginable to the vast majority of international schools in the world, AISG has already shown glimpses of its true potential during the course of its 16-year existence.  Many of its graduates have gone on to success at colleges and universities in the United States, the Middle East, and elsewhere, and have brought their learning home to benefit their community.  If allowed to progress and thrive through the current hard times in the middle east area in general in Gaza strip in particular, it will serve as a building block for the development of a strong local economy, producing graduates with the tools and skills to contribute to Gaza’s economic growth. 

Though we are a private school, we are also a non-profit organization. Student tuition covers only the basic operating costs of our organization.

Contemporary American and international education, with its emphasis on critical thinking, free inquiry, and internationalism, can help guide Gaza’s cultural life in a positive and constructive direction and enable the youth of Gaza to build bridges with their counterparts in the United States and elsewhere.

Our Project

Gaza is a large, but extremely isolated city. Access to school level English literature is limited. For many of our students, making the trip to a the public library is simply not an option that will give them any English literature Novels. Therefore, our school is the only place these students can obtain books in English. We feel that it is our duty to make more books available.

Our project goal of $12,000 will be used to buy classroom sets of novels for grades K-12, as well as to meet the needs of our growing school library and expand our book collection.

The classroom sets that we will purchase include the majority of the books that our students will use in elementary school, middle school, as well as those that they will need for the next four years of high school and the SAT program. These books are integrated into our curriculum and will help us achieve our standards for literature and language arts. The list of books includes (but is not limited to)

Harry Potter and the Sorcerer’s Stone, Holes, Stone Fox, Tuck Everlasting, Music of the Blue Dolphins, And Then There Were None, Fever 1793, The Bad Beginning, Catch-22, Death of a Salesman, House on Mango Street, The Red Badge of Courage, Frankenstein, Adventures of Sherlock Holmes, and The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Nighttime.

We will be purchasing the books in bulk from The Reading Warehouse, and shipping them (for free!) to a U.S. location. We will then ship them to the Gaza (via Israel). The customs fees and taxes, as well as the shipping costs, are calculated into our goal.

In the event that we do not reach our goal we will purchase as many classroom sets as funding allows, focusing on our immediate needs for the rest of this year. Any amount that you can contribute will go towards getting us these books, and we thank you in advance for your help!

For more detailed information about our book lists or projected costs, please email us at: m.owdaa@aisg.ps

The Impact

Taking the opportunity to donate a book to any child is a valuable thing. However, by donating to this campaign you are putting English reading material in the hands of a student who would not otherwise be able to find it.

These books will be invaluable to us as our school moves forward. These classroom sets will be used year after year, and will continually challenge and advance our students' learning. With your one-time donation, you will be part of a library legacy within Pioneers Baccalaureate School.

Please check out our "perks" (located on the right), and get on board!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is in a position to donate at this time. We would also fully appreciate your help in spreading the word about our school and our project. By sharing our story with people that you know can help, you are doing us a wonderful service. Thank you!

story:
Every Parent Wants Only The Very Best For Their Children! 

We Try To Provide Them With Education & Comfort, To Make Them Create A Personality Of Their Own & Stand Bravely In A Society Whose Future Literally Hangs Upon Our Children! 
To assist  in this effort, here in Kiddy Smart my team of innovative parents and I have brought in production “The Smart Kart”. The first of its kind – With a downloadable parent app to help bring a more customized  learning experience to your infant/toddler combined with  fun and of course a snug ride to fit every stage of growth both mentally and physically ALL WHILE KEEPING IT GREEN! #NOWASTE #RECYCLED #GOGREEN

                  ***Designed with precious cargo in mind. 

This innovative and stylish all-in-one travel system provides a convenient way for parents to interact with their little ones while on the go! #parentinvolvement  

**Recent  studies show parents spend about  $100-$300 on just a car seat.

**Recent studies show parents spent on average for  a ~standard  stroller~$400 -$800 or more and for the ~higher end strollers~ prices started at $1000 and up with most  being sold as separates . 

The Smart Kart has revolutionized the way parents transport their precious cargo by generating a  first and last solution to parents looking for the ultimate travel system experience that you only will have to pay for once!    Lets take a closer look ! Below is a breakdown of  This game-changing travel system with innovative technology  and its apps multi-functions : 

*App will be downloadable from both play store and apple store  

 *App will be able to  master control  whatever is on the tablet 

*Parent can preset time restrictions on ALL activities 

*Restrictions on what can be seen 

*Parent will be able to control screen to screen movement on the tablet  

*The app will keep a log of the child's progress with each learning activity prompting the parent when it is time for the child to graduate to the next level once parent grants permission the app will automatically advance to the next level 

*Lastly in between activities the app will initiate a down time period with soothing music playing in the background for toddler to take a break from staring at the screen   

The Smart Kart feature breakdown: 

Smart Grow Car Seat : Attaches the base to fully assemble The Smart Kart! 

The Smart Grow Car Seat exceeds the expectations of the typical all-in-one car seat ! 

*ability to grow with child from infant to 7 years old or 70 lbs

*comes with toddler tablet attached with unique predownloaded apps (controlled by parent through our parent app) 

*the toddler table has 1 insulated bottle/cup holder on each side of the tablet 

*5 point harness seat belt for maximum safety  

*comes with a base for your car  

*retractable UV shade 

*Smart Grow car seat will also serve as the stroller seat once child has transitioned to the point of expanding the car seat into toddler seat  

*The seat will be able to swivel and lock in 360 degrees while connected to stroller base 

*Ability to high lift and shift this will accommodate infant/toddler to the table ready for every meal! (no more highchair request!) 

 

*one handed fold down 

* Umbrella comes with a holder holding it in place hands free so that mommy or daddy can focus on SAFELY pushing their precious cargo rain, sleet ,snow or bright and sunny  

*4- cup Holder slides in and out with the push a button  

*Large storage with stretchy leather or cloth material 

*Weight balancer to level out the tilt ratio (basically so baby doesn’t tip over due to any imbalance in weight placed on the top of the stroller) :)

 

Thank you for taking this journey with us!

 

With the “Early Education – The SMART Way” technique our infant/toddlers will learn and play at the same time.

                              *OUR BACKING GUARANTEE FOR OUR BACKERS *

We stand behind our product and we APPRECIATE our backers standing behind it as well.And for backing us forward into full production we have put in place a 15 day money back guarantee  once you receive the finished product ,if you are not 100% satisfied  .You will receive a full refund no questions asked .However,your feed back will always be important to us ,as it is essential in our goal to bring you the best products. Thanks again for your support!
