story:
A World At Your Fingertips

SkillBox is a learning platform that is fast, simple, and consistent in format. SkillBox gives anyone the ability to conquer any skill or master any subject – all while being packaged in an affordable, modern, mobile-friendly application. With SkillBox tap into a wealth of high-quality courses that can upscale yourself and your future. With SkillBox, you can:

 

 

SkillBox is a learning platform that is fast, simple, and consistent in format. SkillBox gives anyone the ability to conquer any skill or master any subject – all while being packaged in an affordable, modern, mobile-friendly application.

 

 

 SkillBox Solves These Problems While Making Learning Faster, Simpler, and To The Point.

Consistent Quality

SkillBox only works with certified instructors and trained professionals whom are ready and waiting to create more amazing courses that are all pre-approved before being listed on our platform. With SkillBox, we’ll give you access to courses that not only cover exactly what you need to know, but are actually fun to watch and listen to.

 

 This is what the SkillBox app will look like, A New Learning Platform Designed To Work With Any Phone or Tablet.

 Affordable, Mobile Friendly, and Easy One Handed Use, SkillBox Makes E-Learning Better!

Two Quizzes and One Test For Every Course On SkillBox To Add Consistency and Allow For Testing of Knowledge.

No Matter Which Subject You Want To Learn SkillBox Packages It In A Fast, Simple, and To The Point Way.

Vetted Courses By Qualified Teachers and A Consistent Format of Short, Fast, To the Point Videos For Every Course

 Ready To Start Your New Career As An Artist? Or How About Learn Spanish Before You Take That Trip To Spain? SkillBox Brings Mobile Friendly High Quality Learning Material On The Go!

 Fast, Simple, Focused Videos Which Cover A Key Concept or Topic In The Wider Course

 Upgrading Your Future With Simple, Fast, To The Point Learning Is Easy With SkillBox

  • Made to work with your mobile device
  • Affordable and value-packed
  • Designed to work with slower internet
  • Built and optimized to work with all budget and affordable phones
  • Courses are made by only certified and qualified instructors
  • All of our courses are vetted for quality, accuracy, and consistency
  • All of our classes and courses are designed to be fast and efficient in delivering information
  • All courses are consistent in their layout, format, and presentation
  • All of our teachers are vetted for certifications, degrees, and diplomas

Each course is made up of no more than thirty consecutive, vertical, 2.5-minute bite-sized videos, to keep every course consistent in being fast and to the point. 

 (Short 15-second video showing basic course navigation action)

 

  • Each Video is capped at 2.5 minutes
  • Each Video is Vertical to accommodate mobile phones, tablets, and multitasking on computers to optimize screen real-estate
  • Each video covers a key-concept in the wider course
  • Every course is made up of no more than 30 clips to keep a fast to the point focused learning experience.

SkillBox is made for you

Need to study for a test? Ready to learn a new skill? Wanting to improve your knowledge for your new job? We make understanding any subject or skill fast, simple, and easy. All of our courses are set from beginner, intermediate, and advanced to take you from novice to expert – all within the comfort of your phone.

Get College Ready

SATs, ACTs, OMG! College can be overwhelming, but SkillBox will help you master your modules in no time.

 

Build Beautiful Platforms

From visually stunning websites and user-friendly apps, to exciting games and platforms, we’ll show you how to do it all… and do it well.

 

Fast-Track Your Career

Choose from Adobe Creative, Microsoft, Apache OpenOffice, Apple iWork, and more incredible software suites!

 

Skyrocket Your Skillsets

Bring out your inner artist, chef, polyglot, musician, designer... Anything! Join an E-Learning platform that puts you first.

IMPROVE THE WAY YOU LEARN WITH SKILLBOX 

 

Fast, Simple, and Affordable Learning

Sometimes, the things we learn actually do seem like rocket science! SkillBox turns even the most complex of topics into easy-to-follow, affordable courses that clearly guide you through everything you need to know without costing a fortune.

 

 

Fast, Simple and Affordable Learning

Sometimes, the things we learn actually do seem like rocket science! SkillBox turns even the most complex of topics into easy-to-follow, affordable courses that clearly guide you through everything you need to know without costing a fortune.

 

 

 

Our Mission

At Evertus, we are set out to improve Accessibility, Quality, Affordability, and Efficiency in learning. Learning should be something that is consistent in allowing anyone to pick up any skill with no previous experience in a fast and simple way. Our purpose is to make a more consistent quality and format in learning for everyone - regardless of language, education level, income, time, or location. At the same time we will lift up educators from all over the world directly by giving them a platform and format to reach more people while making an income. We will use this improved way of learning to invigorate a passion for education worldwide, and we are going to bring this in a package that works from the comfort of your phone.

Raunak

Hello! I’m Raunak, The creator of SkillBox and the founder of Evertus. For 7 years, I have worked within the IT industry. My work and expertise has taken me around the world, giving me the opportunity to tackle different job positions and work with diverse teams. I have a deep passion for creating solutions to problems that needs to be solved in a fun and intuitive way! Being able to engage people and guide them in their learning journey is one of my strengths, and therefore one of the most fulfilling experiences during my time in the industry. With SkillBox, I can take my passion for education and make it fun! 

John

Hello! I am John, a co-founder and the acting head project director.  Over the past 4 years, I have held a career in logistics as a mentor and teacher. Being able to walk new people through my industry through complex problems and obstacles is one of my greatest joys in life. The experience of being a mentor through careful articulation and structured hands on learning allowed me to show my students how to overcome challenges, ranging from financial well being to time management and everything in between. To me, SkillBox is a way to continue building my passion for teaching. With SkillBox, I believe we have the opportunity to make education better by building a more structured and easy to follow method of learning.

Ted

Hello! I’m Ted, a Co-Founder and the acting Creative Director of Evertus. I am a performer, graduating from the School of the Arts, Singapore (SOTA) in Music and currently studying at the National University of Singapore (NUS). I have years of experience touching the lives of people through my voice and creative process. As an artist, learning has always been a lifelong passion for me, and a platform where we can impact people through education has always resonated with me. With SkillBox, can we create the new face of learning!

Rahul

Greetings! I am Rahul, one of the co-founders of Evertus, and responsible for talent acquisitions in the team. I have a deep passion for IT, and am currently pursuing my degree in IT at James Cook University, Singapore (JCU). I have a knack for software development. Not only that, I also volunteered as a mathematics teacher in India. My experiences made me aware of the progress that needs to be made with the current E-learning tools out in the market. With Skillbox, I believe we can be the solution to creating an efficient, more accessible educational platform.

Sean

Hey there! I am Sean, one of the co-founders of Evertus, and am in charge of vetting course content. I have a passion in both the arts and IT, having graduated from School of the Arts, Singapore (SOTA) with a specialisation in Visual Arts and currently pursuing my degree in IT at James Cook University, Singapore (JCU). My deep experience in the arts and my newfound knowledge in IT, allows me to work with our content creators and make the aesthetic choices that make courses in SkillBox engaging and intuitive. With SkillBox, I believe we have the power to further education!

 

With content being vetted for quality, fast focused videos making up a course, a consistent format for every subject, and an affordable price. SkillBox makes learning what it should be - Accessible, Efficient, Affordable, and simply better.  Upscale your career and knowledge with SkillBox today!

Being able to walk new people through my industry through complex problems and obstacles is one of my greatest joys in life. The experience of being a mentor through careful articulation and structured hands on learning allowed me to show my students how to overcome challenges, ranging from financial well being to time management and everything in between. To me, SkillBox is a way to continue building my passion for teaching. With SkillBox, I believe we have the opportunity to make education better by building a more structured and easy to follow method of learning.TedHello! I’m Ted, a Co-Founder and the acting Creative Director of Evertus. I am a performer, graduating from the School of the Arts, Singapore (SOTA) in Music and currently studying at the National University of Singapore (NUS). I have years of experience touching the lives of people through my voice and creative process. As an artist, learning has always been a lifelong passion for me, and a platform where we can impact people through education has always resonated with me. With SkillBox, can we create the new face of learning!RahulGreetings! I am Rahul, one of the co-founders of Evertus, and responsible for talent acquisitions in the team. I have a deep passion for IT, and am currently pursuing my degree in IT at James Cook University, Singapore (JCU). I have a knack for software development. Not only that, I also volunteered as a mathematics teacher in India. My experiences made me aware of the progress that needs to be made with the current E-learning tools out in the market. With Skillbox, I believe we can be the solution to creating an efficient, more accessible educational platform.SeanHey there! I am Sean, one of the co-founders of Evertus, and am in charge of vetting course content. I have a passion in both the arts and IT, having graduated from School of the Arts, Singapore (SOTA) with a specialisation in Visual Arts and currently pursuing my degree in IT at James Cook University, Singapore (JCU). My deep experience in the arts and my newfound knowledge in IT, allows me to work with our content creators and make the aesthetic choices that make courses in SkillBox engaging and intuitive. With SkillBox, I believe we have the power to further education! With content being vetted for quality, fast focused videos making up a course, a consistent format for every subject, and an affordable price. SkillBox makes learning what it should be - Accessible, Efficient, Affordable, and simply better.  Upscale your career and knowledge with SkillBox today!

story:
Pledge now to bring this game to life, help us to build a curriculum that is actual FUN & GAMES and inspire children to love learning new skills for life!

 

 

Building upon the success of our first game, launched on Kickstarter earlier this year: the Which Way? Coding Board Game, we are now developing a whole portfolio and curriculum of educational games, stories and digital experiences for young children to learn at home and in the classroom.

We support STREAM learning:

 

 

Team OjO is thrilled to introduce our latest designs, prototypes, plans and dreams for our next awesome educational board game Movie Director:

Direct your own mini-movies and solve maths problems at the same time

The Problem

The early years are a crucial time for children to learn as much about their world as possible. Their brains are like sponges during this period and so it’s vitally important that children are spending time on activities that are beneficial to their learning and development.

 

 

The Solution

To help parents and educators make the most of this critical development stage, we have designed a set of educational resources (the first in a series) based around math-based word problems.

Play the game, read the books and interact with the app. After all that practice, your children will be confident about their word problem-solving abilities!

The idea is to:

  • Get children (and parents!) excited about learning
  • Break-down tricky academic concepts into more friendly ideas
  • Reinforce concepts by offering different media through which to receive them i.e. games - kinaesthetic, storybooks - audio + visual, apps - visual

 

Why Word Problems?

Word problems are a great place to start because they involve so many different skills that apply during later life as well as at school. Growing up, and as an adult, we encounter real-life maths problems every day and they rarely come to us already organised into neat equations. It is up to us to dissect the situation, identify the relevant information and formulate it into a problem that we can solve.

Learning these skills from a young age sets children up to solve similar problems when they enter the workplace and adult life.

Examples of Grown-up Math Word Problems:

If I earn £1500 per month, bills cost £900, food £100 and travel £100, how much do I have left to save?

If I have £30,000 of savings already in my bank account and save £200 per month with an interest rate of 1% earned, how many years will it take for me to save enough to pay for a house deposit of £50,000?

 

Help us Reach our Goal of £1000!

 

 

Make your comparison with the table above and then select your reward. Be the first to pledge and get exclusive Early Bird discounts! Please note that shipping costs and duty (if any) are not included in the table above.

 

The Importance of Word Problems

1. How maths applies to the real world

Maths is initially an abstract subject that might seem irrelevant to everyday life. Maths problems however, clearly describe situations where maths skills are essential. This in turn encourages children to practice using maths to solve problems.

2. Develop higher order thinking and critical thinking skills

Word problems can be confusing because they contain extra information that may or may not be relevant to the question. Children are required to call upon a variety of skills simultaneously such as literacy, numeracy, imagination and critical thinking skills, to process this information, extract what’s relevant and use it to find the correct answer.

3. Apply different maths concepts simultaneously

Math word problems are also an effective way to teach children how to use different types of maths skills at the same time to solve a problem. For example a problem may require knowledge of algebra, fractions and multiplication in order to find the answer.

4. Maths can be creative too

For challenging math word problems, a child may need to approach them in a new way. When confronted with a new challenge, we are forced to search a bit harder for potential methods to a solution and this is a creative process. Bringing seemingly disparate skills and knowledge together forms new links in the brain, giving way to new ideas.

5. Evaluate a child’s comprehension

When a child begins to succeed at solving a particular kind of math word problem, it signals to the parent or teacher that they have understood the concepts involved. This provides a useful tool in determining a child’s progress and their level of confidence.

 

How to Play

1. Lay out the Set Board and sand timer, separate the Movie Cards into piles according to age range and sort Prop Cards into groups.

2. Decide which player goes first by placing the Award Cards face-down (remember to shuffle!) and each turning over a card until someone picks up the Oscar. Whoever gets the Oscar plays the Movie Director role first (Player 1).

3. Player 2 (sitting to the right of Player 1) picks a Movie Card off the top of the pile and reads it aloud slowly for Player 1. Player 2 then places the card face up so that Player 1 can read it again if they need to.

4. Player 1 has 1 minute to choose a Set from the Set Board, choose their Prop Cards and act out the Movie Card. If they don’t solve the problem before the sand timer finishes, move on to the next player without recording any points.

Tip: Increase the number of sand timer flips to accommodate your child if they need more time to begin with.

5. Player 1 must act out the movie by arranging the Prop Cards on the Set Board to solve the problem, even if they already know the answer, otherwise they cannot be a Movie Director!

6. Player 2 then takes their turn while Player 3 (or Player 1 if only two are playing) reads the next Movie Card aloud.

7. Play to the best of 3. Whoever solves 3 problems first wins the round.

8. Whoever wins the best of 3 rounds wins the game and receives the Oscar award.

 

Inside the Box

Each game comes with instructions, answer sheets and links to more content online.

 

Top Features

 

Contact Us

If you have questions, suggestions or opportunities for us, please get in touch! You can comment our Indiegogo campaign, drop us an email or chat with us via one of our social media channels listed below.

learnwithojo.com // info@learnwithojo.com // Facebook // Instagram // Twitter // Youtube // LinkedIn

 

Share on Social Media

Spread the word! Please share our campaign with your friends and family.

 

The Team

Meet the OjO Team! Founded by Maha in 2016, our little team has grown. We are busy working together to bring you high quality educational games and experiences!

 

Timeline

 

We plan to begin fulfilling orders by October this year. Of course if there are any delays, we will keep you updated.

 

Risks & Challenges

Despite the fact that we have successfully managed 2 crowdfund campaigns before, the risks and challenges involved are the same.

Product Manufacturing

All of our products are tested with children, education experts and safety labs before to ensure they're safe, suitable and practical for young children to play with.

We are working with a trusted manufacturer that came recommended to us to produce the game. We maintain open and friendly communication, with a team member on site to ensure timely delivery and swiftly deal with any issues that might arise.

Shipping

We will start shipping as soon as the first batch is complete!

We promise to keep our backers updated about any issues that may occur that could impact the date of delivery. Please check this site for updates.

Please note also that you will be responsible for any customs duties, fees and import taxes applicable to your region.

Product Guarantee

Should you experience any problems with the game, send it back to us. We’ll happily replace any missing or faulty parts and send you a new one free of charge.

 

THANK YOU

story:
FEcomics&games 2015!

L'associazione culturale Pro Art di Ferrara organizza per il 13 e 14 Giugno 2015 la prima edizione di Fecomics&games, la prima grande fiera del Comics, del Games, del Cosplay e del Japan nel centro storico di Ferrara.
Le più belle piazze e i palazzi antichi della città ospiteranno spazi espositivi, incontri, workshop, presentazioni e spettacoli tutti dedicati al mondo del Comics in tutte le sue sfacettature. Insomma....un weekend magico avvolti nella nostra grande e bella città!




Sostieni Fecomics&games 2015!

Siamo alla nostra prima edizione e abbiamo bisogno di tutto il sostegno che riusciamo ad ottenere!
Noi organizzatori principali, e il nostro Team che si occupa delle varie aree della fiera, stiamo lavorando moltissimo al solo scopo di realizzare un grande sogno...realizzare finalmente una grande e bella fiera del Comics nel centro storico di Ferrara!

Sono in cantiere molti progetti e non passa giorno che qualche idea straordinaria ci venga in mente o ci venga proposta da altri. Ma purtroppo niente è senza costi e visto che la nostra intenzione è quella di crescere e di offrire sempre qualcosa di più ai visitatori della nostra fiera ci è venuto in mente di chiedere un piccolo aiuto ai nostri amici e sostenitori.
Ci sono tante novità in fase di sviluppo. Seguiteci sui nostri profili per scoprirle: inanzitutto il nostro sito (www.fecomics.it) e poi la pagina Facebook , il profilo Twitter  e il profilo Instagram.

Il testo stesso di questa campagna verrà continuamente aggiornato per presentare le cose su cui stiamo lavorando.

Aiutaci a realizzare un sogno!

Come verranno impiegate le donazioni?

Per sostenere le spese di una manifestazione sempre più importante, che però vuole cercare di rimanere per sempre ad ingresso gratuito, e per poter garantire un certo livellò di qualità abbiamo sempre più bisogno di sponsor e sostenitori che ci aiutino in questa impresa... titanica!

Nello specifico, tutti i fondi che riusciremo a raccogliere saranno così impiegati:

  • Ospitalità per i componenti delle associazioni senza scopo di lucro che saranno presenti alla nostra manifestazione e che ci aiuteranno a realizzare animazione nelle due giornate.

  • Migliorare le strutture per allestimenti ed impianti.

  • Poter offrire eventuali spettacoli e attività gratuite di buon livello.

Nella colonna qui a fianco trovate i simpatici gadget che abbiamo preparato appositamente per voi in cambio della vostra gentile donazione...un ricordo indelebile del vostro aiuto.
Potete scoprirete meglio questi premi nel dettaglio in un'apposita sezione a fondo pagina (Descrizione Premi).

Tutti i fondi raccolti con questa campagna saranno impiegati per la realizzazione dell'evento.
Anche se non raggiungeremo l'obiettivo, la manifestazione si terrà comunque e impiegheremo al meglio il capitale raccolto....vi daremo il dettaglio di tutte le spese sotenute con le vostre offerte!



Come posso fare una donazione?

Fare una donazione è molto semplice!
Lo puoi fare con carta di credito o tramite PayPal. Puoi fare una donazione libera o scegliere di ricevere in cambio una dei "premi" che abbiamo preparato per te. Facendo una donazione libera hai anche la possibilità di scegliere di rimanere anonimo.

Noi ti ringrazieremo subito per qualsiasi donazione; infatti al termine di questa campagna ringrazieremo pubblicamente tutti i nostri sostenitori con una apposita pagina sul nostro sito ufficale (www.fecomics.it) e sulla nostra pagina Facebook.
Puoi scegliere di ricevere il premio che hai scelto comodamente a casa tua...oppure venire in fiera a trovarci e ritirare di pesona il premio presso il nostro punto "Info".... poi però naturalmente scatta il Selfie d'obbligo! :)

Per effettuare la donazione, basta cliccare sul bottone CONTRIBUTE NOW (lo trovi a fianco della locandina)  dopo aver immesso una cifra o scelto fra quelle proposte, oppure basta cliccare sul premio desiderato. Seguendo i passi proposti dal sito, si arriverà ad una pagina PayPal tramite cui sarà possibile accedere al proprio conto oppure usare la carta di credito.

La cifra indicata è quella che ci permetterà di sostenere parte delle spese di FEcomics&games. Se con questa campagna riusciremo a raccogliere una cifra superiore a quella stabilita (magari!), l'importo in eccedenza verrà impiegato in un ulteriore miglioramento della manifestazione....niente andrà sprecato tranquillo! ;)
Se invece non riuscissimo a raggiungere la somma prefissata....niente panico! Come detto sopra, la manifestazione la faremo comunque e vi spediremo o vi consegneremo comunque i premi!


Descrizione Premi

Qui trovi le foto dei vari gadget che riceverai a seguito della tua donazione!

Inseriremo nei prossimi giorni la foto della spilla e magari altri nuovi interessanti premi ....state connessi! :)


Spille personalizzate da 38 mm a 5 Euro


Tazze personalizzate a 20 Euro


Portachiavi con luce a 10 Euro



Lastra fotografica in metallo 20x30 personalizzata a 40 Euro



Shopper in cotone personalizzata FEcomics a 20 Euro



Cos'altro posso fare per FEcomics&games?

Puoi fare tantissimo!

Attraverso il nostro sito ufficiale e le nostre pagine Facebook e Twitter troverai notizie e aggiornamenti sulla nostra fiera e potrai inviarci i tuoi suggerimenti, i tuoi apprezzamenti o, perchè no, anche le tue critiche...tanto per farci capire se stiamo lavorando nel modo giusto! ;) Più partecipi attivamente, più contribuirai a far conoscere FEcomics & Games anche ai tuoi amici e aiutarci a realizzare una manifestazione fantastica piena di gente felice! ;)

E non dimenticare... il tuo aiuto è fondamentale per far crescere questo nostro grande progetto! Condividi e fai conoscere a tutti questa campagna sui tuoi profili "social" e se hai delle domande, richieste, o curiosità scrivici subito a info@fecomics.it o mandaci un messaggio sulla nostra pagina Facebook...noi rispondiamo a tutti! :)

Se poi vuoi aiutarci concretamente, puoi anche contattare noi organizzatori per proporti come volontario dello STAFF... reclutiamo per diverse attività, dalla promozione all'allestimento....qui c'è sempre posto per tutti! :)

Vi Aspettiamo! ;)

attività, dalla promozione all'allestimento....qui c'è sempre posto per tutti! :) Vi Aspettiamo! ;)

story:
On the 8th of April 2015 I`m going to Nepal, and I`m going to Naiche village in Lamjung district. It is a remote village as it is situated far from any of the tourist route. I am planning to bring different useful goods and gifts for the villagers and also to stay in the village to teach some English at the village school. There are 100 villagers there, they live very poor, but happy life. They live in a community  and share everything equally between all the community members. There are 39 children at the village school. I have already been in this village 6 months ago and made friends with all the villagers. I know all these people personally and the raised funds will be used for the contribution and help for the certain people from the certain village.

 Here is the story.

I am  a film production manager. Originally from Ukraine, but now living and working in Warsaw, Poland. Last year I came to Nepal for the first time with the film crew, we were shooting a documentary film in Lamjung district. While doing location searching we were advised by the locals to go to a beautiful village of Naiche, a village which remains remote (and that`s why interesting for us as a filmmakers), because it lies away from the tourist trekking routes and any guests are quite rare there. Finally we spent about 3 weeks in this village, living in the homes of the villagers while we were shooting our film. We were absolutely impressed with the great people of the village and their outstanding community way of life. The inhabitants of the village are from the Gurung tribe. They live very simple life, almost without using money, just sharing goods among themselves, no TV`s (at least I haven't seen any while staying there). Children are attending the school, but very often even without  having a pen or a copybook...they play with stones, old bicycle wheels or even with the... goat leg. The villagers are very  poor, but incredibly nice, respectful and helpful. During that time we had one trip to Kathmandu where we bought different useful things for the villagers, including torches, electric cables, pens, copybooks, badminton, football balls, volleyballs, pomps, batteries, colourful pencils, and many other things and brought them to the village. I have got an appreciation letter from the school`s principal - the main person in the village. 
And I decided and promised the village people that I will come to the village again.
I`m going there with my friend, we have prepared a short programme for teaching English for children and we plan to buy school supplies for 39 children and goods for 100 villagers. Besides, I want to print my photos - portraits of the villagers and bring them as a present as well.   Unfortunately the flights, insurance, basic trip costs are very high and it seems we are out of money now and we do not have enough money for all these. That`s why I am asking for help on the crowd funding webpage. I will be very grateful if you will join and help me to make presents to this people. Every single dollar is important and will help. You will see the results of your help and contribution on my photos.

story:
24 heures de science c'est...

LA fête des sciences et des technologies au Québec. Du vendredi 8 mai à midi jusqu’au samedi 9 mai même heure, incluant la nuit du vendredi au samedi, ce sont plus de 300 activités qui seront présentées: animations, ateliers, visites de labos, conférences, bars des sciences, défis, etc. 

Coordonné depuis maintenant 10 ans par Science pour tous, un organisme sans but lucratif qui rassemble plus de 300 organismes de culture scientifique au Québec, le 24 heures de sciences de 2015 offrira plusieurs centaines d'activités conçues pour des publics de tous les âges dans les 17 régions du Québec. Nous avons besoin d'aide pour le faire rayonner encore davantage et pour le faire connaître au plus de gens possibles. 

Le site Internet de cette 10e édition, qui se tiendra les 8 et 9 mai 2015 recence plus de 300 activités partout au Québec! Visitez-le:  www.science24heures.com.

Grâce à votre soutien

À l'occasion de ce 10e anniversaire, nous voulons organiser une vaste campagne de promotion pour faire connaître nos activités partout au Québec, notamment dans les régions éloignées. Vos dons nous permettront :
- d'engager une attachée de presse,
- d'encarter notre programme dans des journaux,
- et de diffuser des publicités télévisées (dans le cadre d'un partenariat média).

Tout cela nous est totalement impossible sans ce financement collectif auquel nous appelons tous ceux qui croient à l'importance de la culture scientifique et technologique. Nous vous encourageons à nous soutenir: donnez selon vos moyens, mais soyez nombreux à soutenir le 10e anniversaire du 24 heure de science, un événement sans pareil en Amérique du Nord.

Les 300 activités de culture scientifique organisées dans le cadre de l'événement doivent tout aux organisations participantes et au bénévolat de nombreux organisateurs. Grâce à eux nous avons enregistré près de 37 000 participants en 2014. Mais la qualité des événements et ateliers du 24 heures de science en mériterait beaucoup plus. La reconnaissance du travail de tous les organisateurs d’activités passe par la participation du public à leurs activités, c'est pourquoi, pour notre 10e anniversaire, nous rêvons de démultiplier la participation au 24 heures de science! Pour atteindre cet objectif, nous manquons cruellement des moyens financiers qui nous permettraient de faire connaître cette invitation à tous les Québécois. Nous avons subi les coupes du gouvernement dans une subvention déjà insuffisante. C'est pourquoi nous faisons appel à vous!

La culture scientifique partout au Québec pour pouvoir débattre ensemble de notre avenir

Connaître et comprendre les sciences et les technologies est essentiel pour comprendre notre époque et pouvoir participer aux débats de société. C'est dans ce cadre que s'inscrit le 24 heures de science.

Pour célébrer son 10e anniversaire, l'événement aura pour thème: Lumière sur la science. Cette année, plus d'une centaine d'activités auront un lien avec la lumière. La lumière nous rassemble en un univers qu’elle éclaire et modèle à l’infini! Du Big Bang aux étoiles, en passant par les origines de la vie ; de l’infiniment petit à l’infiniment grand; de la maîtrise du feu aux technologies les plus modernes, la lumière est partout, dans l’histoire de l’univers, comme dans celle de l’humanité. 

Notre défi

Nous savons que les délais sont serrés mais nous avons un plan de match établi qui nous permettra de réaliser nos différentes actions de promotions supplémentaires rendues possibles grâce à cette campagne de financement. Nous sommes prêt et plein d'idées pour accroître le rayonnement de l'événement, et donc de la culture scientifique au Québec!

Passez le mot au plus de gens possible! Nous avons besoin de l'aide de tous.

story:
Short Summary

Thanks for checking out our cause!  We hope you are as passionate as us about creating a future for Syrian refugees, especially its children.   Because of the conflict begun four years ago, most refugee children are going without basic education and missing years and years of school.  Where will these kids go when they are teenagers and adults?  How will they rebuild their country?
-
However, there are committed and passionate educators among the refugees who work tirelessly to protect the children's future.  One of these educators is Kayes Maddouh, a 25-year-old early career English teachers from central Syria.   I met Kayes when I went to Al-Salam School in Hatay, Turkey, a refugee school.  He showed great interest and initiative in developing as a teacher and using the best education methods, which wasn't part of the normal training that English teachers received in Syria.
-
Specifically, we're seeking to enroll Kayes in the CELTA (Certificate in Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages) course at International House - Izmir in Turkey.  Kayes will study intensively for one month where he will learn about topics such as linguistics, teaching methodology, and do plenty of practice teaching.  He will receive a certificate, which will enable him to seek employment outside of the refugee camps if necessary, and have the freedom to support himself and his family.  But he wishes to remain at Al-Salam and help the children.
-
English skills will help the students reach the outside world; practically, it will help prepare them for careers in business, engineering or medicine; and on a more human level it will help them share their stories around the world.  Kayes is the type of teacher who can inspire kids and show them how to fulfill their potential in a dark and difficult situation.  

What We Need & What You Get

We need $1500 to help supplement Kayes' savings for the total cost of completing the course (about $2100-2200).   It will go toward International House Izmir's tuition fees.  

YOU will receive for helping him:

- $10 donation - our beautiful "The blessings of multiplicity are inevitable" calligraphy artwork (created by an artist in Hatay) on a postcard from Turkey with a personalized thank you note

-$50-100 - "The blessings of multiplicity are inevitable" calligraphy artwork in medium-sized (5" x 7") with a handmade thank you card

The Impact

We say "kids are the future," and in the case of Syria, nothing could be further from the truth.  Most funding for the crisis goes toward immediate aid such as medical care and food, but investing in education is also badly needed to save a generation of kids from falling prey to extremists and confusion in an increasingly fast-paced 21st century world.  

Other Information

More information about International House - Izmir: http://www.ilsizmir.com/
More information about the CELTA certificate: http://www.cambridgeenglish.org/teaching-english/teaching-qualifications/celta/
More information about Al-Salam School, a school for refugees in Hatay Province, Reyhanli, Turkey: http://syriankids.ca/
https://www.facebook.com/syriankidsfoundation?fref=ts
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/syrian-kids-foundation-al-salam-school/x/10489733#home

Other Ways You Can Help

Are you a teacher, curriculum specialist, or other type of education professional?  Want to help some AMAZING refugee children in Hatay?  Check out www.syriankids.ca and see what you can do to help their work, including fundraising or volunteering in Turkey.

story:
Short Summary

As part of the commitment to the mission of transforming lives, Safaricom provides it’s Staff with an opportunity to identify live transforming initiatives across the country and mobilize resources to implement them. Staff is provided with the support and the opportunity to apply their expertise not only in their day to day work assignments but also in avenues that provide channels of development for the communities in which they exist. This is done by encouraging staff to work with the community to identify projects that have a potential to catalyze development and to work together with the community, partners and fellow colleagues to implement them.

Many different initiatives have been successfully implemented across different thematic platforms through this support and partnership, all to the benefit of the country. Such projects include provision of water to water scarce areas, rehabilitation and building of learning facilities, provision of ICT facilities among others. 

47 in 1 initiative is one such project.  This initiative was conceptualized in 2014 September after a successful completion of yet another great initiative by staff.  This is the biggest and most ambitious Initiative Championed by staff in the company and led by Technology division. The initiative aims to support primary education in kenya by bringing ICT enabled, solar powered computer Labs to one primary school in each of the 47 counties in Kenya thereby providing centers of excellence in ICT education access and information in these areas. 


What We Need & What You Get

Through the 47 in 1 initiative, staff in technology division of Safaricom together with their partners and sponsors  aim to Build  one ‘all-in-one’ Solar Powered Computer Lab in a public primary school in each of the 47 counties across the country by the end of year 2015

·  Each lab is estimated to cost approximately KShs. 1.6M.

·  The initiative will consist of 47 teams to match the 47 counties in the country who will champion the initiative at county level and be responsible for all actions needed to deliver the project.

·  A central committee will be selected from staff to co-ordinate the overall project plan and support teams with the fundraising initiative. The central committee will be tasked to mobilize 50% 0f the project cost, (800,000 per country) while the county team members mobilize the remaining 50% needed to make the total cost 1.6M to implement a project.

·  Each team will consist of 14 diverse individuals from different divisions including our internal/external business partners and sponsors and will be headed by a volunteer captain.

·  The Team will then work with the county education office to select a deserving beneficiary school for the county guided by the given criteria.

·  The team will then creatively mobilize the funds needed to deliver the computer lab and work to deliver the sustainability plan for their project.

·  After the funds are received, the teams awill then deliver the pre-fabricated labs to the Nominated primary schools, Train the teachers on use and maintenance of the Labs as well as revenue generating opportunities to keep the project sustained and Mentor the children to use ICT to receive education

·  The project will then undergo formal hand over to the school administration and be monitored for duration of one year after hand over to ensure continued sustainability is established. 


The Impact

Whereas ICT is now an integral part of development our country and the world, many schools across the country still do not have the privilege of accessing this important resource. Unfortunately, most of these areas also lack basic learning facilities that are necessary to ensure adequate learning such as books (text and exercise) and electricity, to allow for more facilities to facilitate learning.  E-learning materials can provide an excellent resource and incentive to embrace ICT especially where physical textbooks are in limited supply. 

. It is therefore in this background that the connected classroom project is engaging partners to provide ICT enabled learning facilities to provide more opportunities to children especially in the remote areas in kenya

sustainability management

Sustainability is about whether or not services, behaviors or practices continue to work and deliver benefits over time. No time limit is set on those continued services, behavior changes and outcomes. In other words, sustainability is about lasting benefits achieved through the continued enjoyment of the positive change.

Sustaining a school’s computer system involves more than just keeping the computers operating and repairing them when they break down. Sustaining a school’s computer system also includes:

·  Having the funds to pay recurring costs for consumable supplies such as ink, toner and paper for printing, cover the additional costs of electricity (or fuel for a generator), and to pay for Internet access.

·  Sustaining a computer system also involves upgrading equipment and software to meet the growing demands of teachers and students.

·  Finally, sustaining a computer system involves replace aging equipment and buying new equipment to increase the level of access by students and teachers.

Sustainability activities will include making sure that the following costs are taken care of.  To begin with, the

•  Operating costs, (including internet access costs, repair costs and consumable supplies costs)

•  Equipment  Upgrades and replacements costs

•  Software Upgrades

•  Staff Training, student introduction and school management engagement and integration of the project.

•  Growth and expansion the System

•  Governance system


Other Ways You Can Help

We are happy to get as much partners in the initiative as it it great and grand. 

Apart from financial support we are happy to connect to e-learning solution providers,institutions interested in forming exchange programs for the beneficiary schools , book sponsorship, internet service sponsors and well wishers in kind. We would be happy to have as many project champions so that we together can  equip these children with the skills needed for the digital age.

Apart from financial support we are happy to connect to e-learning solution providers,institutions interested in forming exchange programs for the beneficiary schools , book sponsorship, internet service sponsors and well wishers in kind. We would be happy to have as many project champions so that we together can  equip these children with the skills needed for the digital age.

story:
Health problems ranging from obesity to diabetes to anorexia all result at least in part from a lack of proper nutrition education. For our senior Apex project, we decided to address this issue.

We chose to focus our efforts on elementary school students because these young students are extremely impressionable, as they are still developing habits that will affect them for the rest of their lives. In addition, elementary schools students can bring what they learn home to help educate their families as well. 

We spent nearly two months researching science-based nutrition and garden education. We learned how crucial hands-on education is for the development of children, and a garden provides a perfect medium for this type of education. After completing our research, we decided to work to expand an existing program called Growing Great to Lomita Magnet School. 

Lomita Magnet School is located less than fifteen minutes from Chadwick in Lomita. Despite their proximity, the students there do not have the same access to nutrition education that I had. 

Growing Great is a non-profit that recruits parent volunteers to teach science-based nutrition and garden education in students from kindergarten to fifth grade. At Lomita Magnet, we will have Chadwick students teach the lessons. Chadwick students who volunteer will go to Lomita Magnet and teach a nutrition or garden-based lesson each week. We will train these volunteers using Growing Great's curriculum in addition to our own research. 

 So far we have raised $2000, which will cover the cost of implementing Growing Great at Lomita Magnet in the 2015-2016 school year. 

Since we will be graduating this year, current sophomores Gracie Waller and Jackie Kunesh will take of the program next year. 

We want the project to continue for future years, so we want to create a fund to continue the program in the future. Each year $2000 dollars will go towards the program, but each year Chadwick students will raise more money for the fund in order to eventually create an endowment fund. We hope that Chadwick students will also eventually work to expand Growing Great to other under-served elementary schools in the Los Angeles area. All donations will go to this fund.

 We believe that no one should be deprived of basic nutritional education. With your help, we can help fill this education void in Los Angeles. Please donate to help our goals become a reality. 

 Sincerely, 

Lindsey and Meghan

story:
Untuk tulisan dalam Bahasa Melayu sila lihat dibawah ini:

A community project to setup INFORMATION CENTRE for the Heritage Of The Kingdom Of Riau Lingga.

The Kingdom of Riau Lingga was once a famour and propresous Malay Kingdom which was located in the Malay Archepelago, was suddenly ended tragically when the Colonial Dutch Government removed Sultan Abdurrahman Muazam Syah from the throne in 1911. Sultan Abdurrahman Muazam Syah together with his family and other Riau Lingga Royal families then moved to Singapore, which is about 30 miles away or about one hour travel by ship from Tanjung Pinang, the Capital city of Riau Lingga.  Two year later, in 1913 the Dutch Colonial Government dissolved the Kingdom of Riau Lingga and slowly removed the details history and valuable artifacts that they able to remove from the Kingdom of Riau Lingga for many years till they left the country in 1949. By that time, the details history and all the remaining ruined palaces, building and historical sites of the Kingdom was almost totally forgotten.

Up to this day there were not much informations that we can access to and to get informations as there is no official Information Centre to promote or to take up necessary action to repair/rebuild all the remaining ruined palaces, building and historical sites of the Kingdom of Riau Lingga. Therefore it is important and necessary to set up the INFORMATION CENTRE for the Heritage Of The Kingdom Of Riau Lingga so that the Kingdom's history, cultures, artifacts and the remaining palaces, building and historical sites can be preserved, compiled, documented and produced in form of writing material, videos, etc. so that it can be distributed and access by everybody all over the world, especially when the Penyengat Island, which was once the administration center of the Kingdom of Riau Lingga, has been recognised as one of the World Calture Heritage by the UNESCO, World Heritage Centre on 5th February 2015.

Please visit: Heritage Of The Kingdom Of Riau Lingga to read and understand more about the history.

Thank you for time, your generous contribution and support for this project. May God Bless you. Aamiin. 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Projek kemasyarakatan bagi menubuhkan Pusat Informasi untuk Warisan Sejarah Kerajaan Riau Lingga.

Kerajaan Riau Lingga adalah sebuah Kerajaan Melayu yang terkenal dan maju terletak di gugusan Kepulauan Melayu, yang begitu malang kerana berakhir secara tiba tiba apabila Pemerintah Penjajah Belanda menurunkan Sultan Abdurrahman Muazam Syah dari tahta pada 1911. Setelah itu, Sultan Abdurrahman Muazam Syah bersama keluarga Baginda serta kerabat kerabat DiRaja Riau yang lain telah berpindah ke Singapura, yang terletak sekitar 30 batu atau sekitar satu jam dengan menaiki kapal dari Tanjung Pinang, ibu kota of Riau Lingga.  Dua tahun kemudian, pada tahun 1913 Pemerintah Penjajah Belanda membubarkan Kerajaan Riau Lingga dan kemudian nya secara pelahan memadamkan maklumat sejarah serta memindahkan artifak artifak berharga yang dapat mereka ambil daripada Kerajaan of Riau Lingga untuk beberapa tahun lamanya sehingga mereka meninggalkan negeri ini pada tahun 1949. Pada waktu itu, hampir semua maklumat sejarah serta bekas bekas Istana, bangunan dan tempat tempat bersejarah telah pun dilupakan.

Sehingga ke hari ini tidak banyak maklumat yang boleh diperolehi kerana tiada pusat maklumat rasmi untuk menyebarkan maklumat atau mengambil langkah langkah bagi membaik pulih/membangunkan semula bekas bekas Istana, bangunan dan tapak tapak sejarah Kerajaan Riau Lingga. Oleh itu ianya penting dan perlu ditubuhkan PUSAT MAKLUMAT Warisan Sejarah Kerajaan Riau Lingga agar sejarah, budaya, artifak artifak serta bekas bekas Istana, bangunan dan tapak tapak sejarah Kerajaan boleh di pelihara, dikumpulkan, didukumentasikan dan dibuat ditulis untuk dibuat risalah/makalah, video dan sebagainya agar dapat diedarkan dan boleh di dapatkan oleh semua orang dari serata dunia, lebih lebih lagi setalah Pulau Penyengat, yang dahulunya merupakan pusat pentadbiran Kerajaan Riau Lingga, diiktiraf sebagai salah sebuah Warisan Budaya Dunia oleh UNESCO, World Heritage Centre pada 5hb Februari 2015.

Sila lawati: Warisan Sejarah Kerajaan Riau Lingga  untuk membaca serta mengetahui lebih lanjut mengenai sejarahnya.

Terima kasih diatas masa anda, sumbangan dan sokongan anda pada projek ini. Semoga Tuhan merahmati kita semua. Aamiin.

story:
Summary

Music education is my biggest passion in life. Because of my love for music, it pains me to watch people face setbacks in their musical endeavors as a result of financial hardships. My desire to provide opportunities for people from underprivileged circumstances is the motivating force behind my Indiegogo campaign.

A compassion for low income families coupled with my musical background make me the prime candidate to establish this Percussion Studio in Fort Worth, Texas.

At any given time, this Percussion Studio will accomodate between 60 and 100 students per week. At least one quarter of these students will receive free weekly lessons due to economic struggles.

Each week I will teach 20 one-on-one lessons as well as 20 group lessons with up to 10 students. In addition to weekly lessons, students will perform concerts throughout the year and compete in various competitions.

What We Need & What You Get

The necessary funding amount is $50,000. This figure will cover the total costs of the facility and instruments.

The Impact

The idea for this Percussion Studio stems from my compassion for at-risk families. During the summers between 2006 and 2011, I worked as a counselor at 3 different Boys and Girls Club of America locations. This job was my first opportunity to impact individuals with considerably underprivileged backgrounds. I immediately fell in love with this environment!

Unfortunately, many families suffer from poverty, and their lack of resources prevent them from realizing their true potential. Too many people have never been able to afford the necessary tools to cultivate their musical talents. I have witnessed this disappointing reality during my last seven years as a band director, and this is the reason I want to start my own Percussion Studio.

Percussion instruction, exposure to musical excellence, performance experience, contacts in the percussion world, and fountains of scholarships will be provided by the Percussion Studio, and all of these things will be within my students' reach with the help of Indiegogo funds.

Risks & Challenges

This campaign can potentially face two significant challenges, but both of them can be overcome.

The first challenge will be recruiting students. As soon as my project is fully funded, I will actively begin seeking students who are interested in participating in the Percussion Studio. My people skills, flexible schedule, and connections with schools and churches will easily allow me to gain the maximum number of students.

In order to purposely recruit underprivileged students, I will partner with local school districts and churches to determine which students endure economic hardships at home. Then I will contact these students' families to inform them about this educational opportunity. The studio is designed for anyone ages 7 and up, so I will also encourage parent and sibling participation as I make contact with families.

The second risk has to do with managing payments from the students who do not face substantial economic hardships. Luckily, my organization skills are sound, and I shouldn't have any trouble keeping track of my students' payments. In fact, Excel is my favorite computer program, and I have plenty of experience using Excel to manage financial information.

These are my Indiegogo campaign's two biggest challenges, but, as I've described above, they shouldn't create much of an obstacle in the way of my Percussion Studio's success.

Other Ways You Can Help

This Percussion Studio will allow students to experience music education like never before! By contributing to this Indiegogo campaign, you will enable students to achieve great musical success despite their financial constraints. Your generosity can get us one step closer to helping students realize their true potential.

I understand if you are unable to monetarily contribute to this campaign, but at least help by spreading the word to everyone you know. Copy and paste my campaign link and send it to all your contacts. Thanks in advance for your contribution, and I look forward to creating exciting musical opportunities with your help!

story:
“Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness.” – Mark Twain

The First Lady Michelle Obama has encouraged university students to travel and study abroad in order to gain valuable experiences and perspectives. Despite her encouragement, only 1% of US students have had this opportunity! The greatest inhibitor being the sheer costs and expenses associated with traveling internationally. Most students would love to have the opportunity to spend a semester or summer abroad, but lack resources.

We established the Teach and Travel program in 2011 to give students from immigrant backgrounds, the chance to teach, intern and study abroad. With the help of generous donors like yourselves, we were able to provide scholarships and stipends that covered all the expenses of most of the students! In 2014, 746 students participated in our program.

The History

Over the years, we have had thousands and thousands of students apply to our program. After interviewing students, the brightest and most promising students were accepted. To date, over 1700 students have participated in the Teach & Travel. Since our inception and in almost all instances their trips were fully covered. Plane tickets were either fully or partially subsidized. Lodging, transportation, food and a stipend were provided for up to three months. Programs were organized in different institutions, where students had the opportunity to both teach and learn. Internships in a wide array of fields were organized giving students an opportunity to gain valuable insight in fields ranging from medicine to business to engineering.

Our Challenges

This year, with our scholarship funding depleted, we are turning to you, generous donors that made this program available in the first place. Our funding has been seriously constrained and we will accept only 400 students this year. We are unable to cover plane tickets either partially or fully. Food and transportation locally will also be responsibility of the participants. The duration of the program has seriously been constrained. In previous years, participant’s entire summer was spent abroad, however this year our program duration will not exceed six weeks.

The Project & Funding Needs

This year we aim to send students from North America all over world, including Germany, India, South Africa, Turkey, Cambodia, Belgium, Bosnia and many more places. We are expecting at least ten- fifteen of the accepted percent of the applicants to drop out immediately due to lack of funds. The total cost per student is $5,000. This includes, fully covered flight tickets, all meals over six weeks, transportation costs and expenses for both local and international coordinators over the summer span.

Your support will:

Cover food and local transportation for 400 students ($1,400,000)

Cover the flight tickets of 400 students ($600,000)

story:
Help us get children out of slums and into schools.


Far too often being HIV positive translates to a life of deprivation, denial, and disgrace. At Living Positive Mlolongo we see things differently. Our team is dedicated to providing treatment, education, and hope to our family of HIV positive women and their children.

Living Positive Mlolongo sends medical personnel to provide desperately needed healthcare to people living in the slums around Mlolongo and ensures health checks are carried out on a weekly basis. Our team also includes three social workers whose kindness and expertise helps families dealing with poverty and disease learn to better cope with their daily struggles.

The Problem 

Despite our best efforts there are many women who die from HIV/AIDs in our community and leave behind orphaned children without anyone to care for them. To make a difference in the lives of these children the best and safest option is to send them to a boarding school. Attending boarding school allows the children to escape the slum, provides them with an education, and ensures they will have food and a safe home while at the school. These are all things that are impossible for them to have while living in the slums.

How You Can Help

Receiving an education will change these children's lives completely and their enthusiasm for education is incredible.The cost of the first year of boarding school is $650 USD and covers all of the items that the child will need for the duration of their education - everything from their mattress to their books and uniforms. For each year after the first year the fee is $550 USD.

The Impact

When you sponsor a child's education you not only change that child's life, you also start a ripple effect that will change the community for generations to come. Education of the next generation is the key to a brighter future for all of Kenya. Your donation to our cause is a small step toward a Kenya free from extreme poverty. Please donate to our cause and help us make a difference.

story:
Touching lives and hearts

Taarana (www.taarana.org.my) was established by Vijayaratnam Foundation in 2011 as an educational centre for children with special education needs. 

Its students are children from 3 to 17 years old who face challenges with the regular school curriculum and have delayed development academically, socially and adaptively. With the support and dedication of a professional staff, this school helps these children to make a smooth transition into society and to live normal fulfilling lives. 

Over the years, through compassionate care and love, Taarana has changed the lives of many of these children and their families.

The school caters to children with ADD/ ADHD, Learning Disabilities, Dyslexia/ Dyspraxia, Sensory-Integration Disorder, Speech Impairment, Global Development Delay, Impulsive Behaviours, Mild Intellectual Impairment, Mild Autism Spectrum Disorder and Down Syndrome. 


WHAT is needed


A financial assistance programme is currently in place to assist children with special needs from poor and lower income families to attend the Taarana school. 

This fundraising campaign is intended to raise funds to support this programme and allow more than 20 other children from similar families to be provided the opportunity to do the same.

You can help make this happen and change the lives of these children.


HOW You Can HELP


  • We need USD 100 000 to ensure that at least 20 children with special needs are able to attend the Taarana school for the whole year. 
  • It costs around USD 600 per child each month.

Your contribution, whatever the amount you decide, will make a difference in the life of a child with special needs.

WE CAN DO THIS!
story_txt:
Touching lives and hearts
Taarana (www.taarana.org.my) was established by Vijayaratnam Foundation in 2011 as an educational centre for children with special education needs. 
Its students are children from 3 to 17 years old who face challenges with the regular school curriculum and have delayed development academically, socially and adaptively. With the support and dedication of a professional staff, this school helps these children to make a smooth transition into society and to live normal fulfilling lives. 
Over the years, through compassionate care and love, Taarana has changed the lives of many of these children and their families.




The school caters to children with ADD/ ADHD, Learning Disabilities, Dyslexia/ Dyspraxia, Sensory-Integration Disorder, Speech Impairment, Global Development Delay, Impulsive Behaviours, Mild Intellectual Impairment, Mild Autism Spectrum Disorder and Down Syndrome. 

WHAT is needed


A financial assistance programme is currently in place to assist children with special needs from poor and lower income families to attend the Taarana school. 
This fundraising campaign is intended to raise funds to support this programme and allow more than 20 other children from similar families to be provided the opportunity to do the same.You can help make this happen and change the lives of these children.   HOW You Can HELP





We need USD 100 000 to ensure that at least 20 children with special needs are able to attend the Taarana school for the whole year. 
It costs around USD 600 per child each month.

Your contribution, whatever the amount you decide, will make a difference in the life of a child with special needs.

 
   WE CAN DO THIS!

story:
Hello, my name is Sofia Higgins. I have been passionate about photography ever since I was introduced to it at 12 years old. For the last several years I have been running a muck with my camera, planning photos and sessions and making them happen. I've been featured in online magazines, both foreign and local. I'm a 16 year old girl unsure of most things. However, I am sure that my ultimate dream is to become a professional photographer. This is the next step on my way there. For me, a girl from the small but loud island of Puerto Rico, to be chosen among over 600 other applicants to participate in one of the most highly acclaimed art programs in the United States, proves even to myself that I am talented and do have what it takes. In school, I try my best earn straight A's and when I set a goal I will do my utmost best to make it happen.

This year I have been accepted to the Tisch Summer High School Photography and Imaging program and hope that we can raise enough funds to make it possible for me to attend it or any program.

Tisch Summer High School Programs are world-renowned, highly acclaimed, and excellent programs where I can polish and finely tune my technique, skill, and artistry as an artist and photographer. The Photography and Imaging program is designed for beginning and advanced students; it is a rigorous combination of cultural, technical, and historical lectures; darkroom work; and critiques of student work. I will take part in the Photography and Imaging course, which would also provide me with 4 college credits. This course introduces students to 35 mm manual cameras, proper black-and-white film exposure, and darkroom printing, as well as color slide film, scanning, basic Photoshop, and digital color printing. Students are expected to photograph both during and outside of class hours. I will also take part in the Studies in Photo course, which would provide me with 2 credits. This course delves into the culture and history of the medium. Students will be assigned readings and visit galleries. All students will participate in critical discussions and written responses to lectures, readings, and visits.

This intense and enriching experience is significant to my photographic training and contributes immensely to my journey to becoming a professional. I have never attended any class or received any formal education on photography but having being chosen among over 600 other applicants is itself an amazing accomplishment and I know I will gain a wealth in knowledge and experience if I were to attend.

This training is expensive and I won't be able to attend without aid financially. Tisch Summer High School Photography and Imaging Program costs a total of $10,873. This includes housing, meals, registration fees and program fees. When we reach this goal in donated funds then we will use this money to pay for the program. Additional funds raised will go towards buying a plane ticket. I was introduced to photography when I was 12 years old. Back then, I only had my backyard and a simple compact camera. Four years later, I'm more serious than ever about photography. I have been my own artist, model, assistant, critic and admirer for four years. I know I am prepared for this type of experience because everything I've accomplished in photography is a result of my hard work and dedication (and the help and support from countless others). I need your help to fund this next big step in my photography career so that I can continue to express everything I am capable of feeling through my photography, develop my artistic skills, and become a professional.

Thank you for your consideration and support to sponsor me. I look forward to hearing from you. Every little bit helps and with enough people I believe that we can make this possible!

If you aren't able to donate, you can still help by spreading the word! Please share my campaign on Facebook, email and tell your friends about it!

Rewards:

I appreciate every little contribution made to help me attend this program and fulfill my potential, so everyone who donates will receive a gift. Everyone who contributes will be listed on this page if they like, with special listing for the higher amounts donated. Depending on the amount donated, sponsors will receive emails and other types of gratitude including cards, prints of your choice, and sessions with me. Immense gratitude is extended to all that contribute to reach this goal!

If you are unable to donate or you would like to do even more to help, you can still participate and help me raise these funds by sharing this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, links or email. The contest is based on how many funds are raised (contributions made) through your referrals. If you qualify for one of these rewards, make sure that I know the right contact information to be able to send it to you.

The time period for this contest is from February 28 to March 14, 2015. Rewards will be given in April, 2015 after the campaign.

Risks:

Of course we all hope that nothing serious will rise up as an obstacle to this campaign and to stop me from accomplishing my goal, but things sometimes happen and I am willing to realize and address those things.

One obvious obstacle is money. My family is not rich, but we do the best we can to afford education to pursue our goals and careers. This fundraiser should help me to afford to attend this summer program and ensure that I can continue in my artistic training. If we are unable to reach the desired goal, funds will go to sending me to another summer program.

You can click the gallery to see some of my selected pieces & these links if you'd like to see more:

https://www.behance.net/sofiahiggins

https://www.flickr.com/photos/sofiarachael/

story:
Hi everyone,

We are a group of students at Rutgers University raising funds to educate women in shelters in India. As a class, we feel passionately about this cause. 

Our current goal is to raise at least $500. If we don't reach it, we will still send whatever we do raise to this cause. Specifically, it is being sent to New Light, which is an organization that raises funds for just that - educating women in shelters in India.

Through this campaign, more women will receive the education they deserve. With your help, we can reach our goal!

Every human being has the right to an education, but unfortunately, these women are not getting one.

Please consider making a contribution, and please spread the word about our campaign!

story:
With the help of more than 1,800 generous supporters, we’re building the striped hyenas a brand-new diorama in the Hall of Asian Mammals! And we couldn’t be more excited.
    

Thank you for making Project Hyena Diorama possible!

Of course, now we have a lot of work to do. We look forward to sharing progress reports throughout the process.

Campaign supporters will receive a message from us soon with more details and information about perks.

If you missed the chance to give online, you can still support the project! Please send offline gifts to The Field Museum, Attn: Erin King, 1400 S. Lake Shore Dr., Chicago, IL 60605 or call (312) 665-7777.

Thank you again for helping us make history at The Field Museum!


The Field Museum has four taxidermied hyenas mounted in 1899 by our first taxidermist, Carl Akeley (leopard fighter, artist, Teddy Roosevelt’s BFF). Right now, they’re in our Reptile Hall (of all places). We want to restore the hyenas and put them in a brand-new habitat diorama in the Hall of Asian Mammals—which is currently missing a diorama.

But we need your help! We’ve teamed up with The Brain Scoop, our in-house YouTube channel, to help make it happen. If funded, The Brain Scoop team will document each step in the process and contributors will get fun perks.

To learn more about Project Hyena Diorama, follow the paw prints below.


Of the 20 planned dioramas in the Hall of Asian Mammals, only 19 were completed more than 60 years ago. Money raised from the Project Hyena Diorama campaign will restore four Carl Akeley-taxidermied striped hyena specimens and move them from their current location in the Reptile Hall to a brand-new habitat diorama inside the Hall of Asian Mammals. Along the way, The Brain Scoop team will document each step in the conservation and build-out process.

It will take a lot to build a diorama people can enjoy for generations to come. (But we can do it with your help!) From the staff time to the lighting to the quality oil paint for the mural, check out how we plan to spend the money raised for Project Hyena Diorama:


At one point striped hyenas were abundant across northern Africa and central Asia, but their current wild population is estimated to be around just 10,000 individuals. With habitat loss and range restrictions, their numbers are decreasing annually. It is important to conserve these creatures in their natural Asian habitat for future generations.

With your support we can make Project Hyena Diorama a huge success, give Carl’s striped hyenas a new home, open up the conservation conversation, fill an empty diorama space in the Hall of Asian Mammals, and you can become a part of museum history!

PLUS more than 1.3 million people visit The Field Museum each year, and over 570,000 of them are children and teachers. Through dioramas, these young explorers have the opportunity to travel the world. With your help, they will be able to see striped hyenas in their natural Asian habitat—before they are gone.

Make a contribution to Project Hyena Diorama and earn fun perks in the process.



Help us spread the word:
  1. Share #ProjectHyenaDiorama on social media! Use the Indiegogo share tools at the top of the campaign page, on the left.
  2. Talk about the project with your friends!


We’re super excited to make this diorama, and have a lot planned. But, ultimately The Field Museum and The Brain Scoop want to say thank you. We greatly appreciate your support!


Q: What is a diorama?

A: A diorama is a three-dimensional replica of a landscape, typically featuring habitat scenes. At The Field Museum, dioramas put visitors face-to-face with environments and life from around the globe to create powerful connections between people and nature.

Q: Why are dioramas important?

A: Dioramas transport Museum visitors unlike any other medium, including technology and other interactives, allowing immersive views into the natural world. The Field Museum’s dioramas help educate the public and give access to environments most people will never see in person.

Q: Why is the striped hyena a good animal to put into a diorama?

A: At one point striped hyenas were abundant across northern Africa and central Asia, but their current wild population is estimated to be around 10,000 individuals. With habitat loss and range restrictions, their numbers are decreasing annually. It is important to conserve these creatures in their natural, Asian habitat for future generations.

Q: Are these new specimens?

A: No, the four striped hyena specimens were brought to The Field Museum after an 1896 expedition. They were originally prepared by one of the pioneers of modern taxidermy, Carl Akeley.

Q: Why create a new diorama?

A: Project Hyena Diorama aims not only to give them a new home in the Hall of Asian Mammals, but also restore the specimens and give them new context and surroundings.

Q: Why is the Museum crowdfunding Project Hyena Diorama?

A: The Field Museum’s digital reach has never been stronger than, or as extensive, as it is right now. As an institution, we are eager to engage our viewers and fans from all over the world and help them become more involved with projects happening in the Museum.

Q: How can I help?

A: Donate and spread the word of #ProjectHyenaDiorama through social media like Facebook and Twitter, email, and actual conversations.

Q: Can I donate offline?

A: Yes! Offline gifts can be sent directly to the Museum at The Field Museum, Attn: Erin King, 1400 S. Lake Shore Dr., Chicago, IL 60605 or by calling (312) 665-7777.

Q: Are gifts tax-deductible?

A: Yes! With each contribution, you will receive a donation acknowledgement email.

Q: How does Project Hyena Diorama fit within The Field Museum’s long-term goals?

A: The Museum aims to strengthen two core areas: scientific excellence and the visitor experience. Project Hyena Diorama exemplifies this vision. It combines collections research and conservation on these often misunderstood creatures with the Museum’s historic habitat dioramas, enhanced by digital and social media. We are proud The Brain Scoop team is leading the effort to engage new audiences in the Museum’s core mission. We look forward to sharing the new hyena diorama with our Indiegogo supporters and millions of visitors from around the world at The Field Museum.

Q: What happens if we don’t raise all the money?

A: The Field Museum will create a scaled version of the project. With your help, Project Hyena Diorama will be a huge success!


Q: When will I get my perks?

A: Each perk has an estimated delivery month/year listed in the description. You will be notified of any delays.

Q: Will any perks go out before the campaign is completed?

A: Unfortunately, no.

Q: How do I tell you what t-shirt size I need?

A: When the campaign comes to an end, we will send you an email, that you can reply to, inquiring about the style and size you want.

Q: What if I want more than one perk?

A: You can make multiple gifts on Indiegogo using a single account. Just make sure you use the same email address and login, so we’ll know that all of your perks are meant to go to the same person.

Q: How much is shipping? What if I'm an international donor?

A: Shipping is included in the perk price, regardless of your location. If you would like to offset the cost of international shipping, we welcome additional gifts of any amount (THANK YOU!). To do this, simply add an additional gift amount during your perk purchase/check out.

Q: How will I get my digital download perk?

A: By email.

Q: What if I want one of the perks and it is sold out?

A: Some perks are only available in limited quantities because of their special nature. So get these perks while they’re hot and contribute now! If possible, we will increase the number of a few limited release perks and we’ll be adding a few more awesome perks throughout the campaign. Stay tuned!
