story:
Summary

My product Up the Ladder  (at http://theverbcompany.net) will provide a better way for millions of adults (and children) to learn to read English, using a new approach based on Linguistics and reading Finnish. I need funds to complete making the product. 

I grew up in Finland where children learn to read by the end of first grade although there is no subject of Spelling in school, nor Reading after the first grade. Finland ranks among the top countries in the world in terms of literacy as well as science and math education.  There is more time to study science and math because reading Finnish is so easy!

I am linguist (Ph.D.) doing research on adults learning to speak a new language, currently a visiting scholar at the Johns Hopkins University (Cognitive Science).  Reading is a real stumbling block for immigrants to the U.S., due to the complexity of English spelling.  

Three parts of my product, Up the Ladder, are ready.  I need funding to pay for the pictures, stories, and recordings for the remaining 5 parts.
What We Need & What You Get

Each of the 8 parts of 'Up the Ladder' contains 10 short video lessons that can be watched on any platform. The student watches/listens to the lesson at their own pace.  Most lessons contain five 3-page stories that reinforce the concept of the lesson.

While I eventually hope to make money out of this endeavor, my goal at this time is to complete the product so it is available for use as soon as possible. This is why I am turning to Indiegogo for funding.  To complete Parts 4-8, I need funds for (total $1,640):

  • the pictures, $140 for one year of clipart
  • the stories, written by a teacher (200 stories, $5 each or $1,000)
  • recording each lesson ($10 a lesson, $500 for the 50 lessons)

If I don't raise the full amount, I will use what I get to pay for as many parts of 'Up the Ladder' as the funds will cover. 

A $25 donation will get you a copy of the full product to try out on anyone you know with reading problems.  

A $100 donation will earn you an individualized "thank-you" on The Verb Company web page, either in your name or in the name of someone else you choose, plus the full product.

The Impact

In addition to immigrants learning English, this product is useful for:

  • native English-speaking adults who feel they never learned to read right
  • middle or high schoolers who have an IEP/are struggling readers
  • ESL students anywhere in the world (English is a world language!)

I believe the product would also be useful for children learning to read for the first time, and once the adult product is ready, I plan to move on to the child version.

By supporting this product, you will make it possible for teachers and learners of English to save countless hours of time.  Saving any amount of time in learning to read English will:

  • get immigrants to a paying job faster
  • reduce the amount of time and funding needed for Special Education and students with an IEP
  • reduce the time/money required to teach English in the developing world
  • once the child product is ready, the time saved in teaching reading can be used to increase math/science education, to improve the international rankings of the U.S.

While this is my first Indiegogo venture, I am familiar with completing big projects successfully, in particular researching and writing my 275-page dissertation, and the 2011 volume on the Acquisition of German that I coauthored with Martha Young-Scholten (culmination of years of research on the topic).  I am also a critical member of a big research project on Adult Second Language Acquisition of English at Newcastle University (England) run by my coauthor Martha Young-Scholten.  (Check my Wikipedia page on Organic Grammar!)

Risks & Challenges

This is ultimately a huge project, with far-reaching ramifications.  

The main challenge would be giving up before reaping the benefits.  I feel so strongly about my approach, though, that I believe that one way or another I will get the adult version finished, and accessible to teachers. (One of my motives was to give back to society while working on something closely related to my passion, Linguistics.)

The other main challenge is getting my web page into a shape that will work well, including international versions.  I am planning to work on this after getting the product finished.

Finally, any money that I am able to make through the web page would go into making a child version of the product that K-2 elementary school teachers could use in teaching reading for the first time.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help at this time, please let someone who might be interested know about my campaign!  (Use Indiegogo share tools)  Also, check out my webpage http://theverbcompany.net.
story_txt:
Summary



My product Up the Ladder  (at http://theverbcompany.net) will provide a better way for millions of adults (and children) to learn to read English, using a new approach based on Linguistics and reading Finnish. I need funds to complete making the product. 
I grew up in Finland where children learn to read by the end of first grade although there is no subject of Spelling in school, nor Reading after the first grade. Finland ranks among the top countries in the world in terms of literacy as well as science and math education.  There is more time to study science and math because reading Finnish is so easy!
I am linguist (Ph.D.) doing research on adults learning to speak a new language, currently a visiting scholar at the Johns Hopkins University (Cognitive Science).  Reading is a real stumbling block for immigrants to the U.S., due to the complexity of English spelling.  

Three parts of my product, Up the Ladder, are ready.  I need funding to pay for the pictures, stories, and recordings for the remaining 5 parts.

What We Need & What You Get

 Each of the 8 parts of 'Up the Ladder' contains 10 short video lessons that can be watched on any platform. The student watches/listens to the lesson at their own pace.  Most lessons contain five 3-page stories that reinforce the concept of the lesson.

While I eventually hope to make money out of this endeavor, my goal at this time is to complete the product so it is available for use as soon as possible. This is why I am turning to Indiegogo for funding.  To complete Parts 4-8, I need funds for (total $1,640):

the pictures, $140 for one year of clipart
the stories, written by a teacher (200 stories, $5 each or $1,000)
recording each lesson ($10 a lesson, $500 for the 50 lessons)

If I don't raise the full amount, I will use what I get to pay for as many parts of 'Up the Ladder' as the funds will cover. 
A $25 donation will get you a copy of the full product to try out on anyone you know with reading problems.  
A $100 donation will earn you an individualized "thank-you" on The Verb Company web page, either in your name or in the name of someone else you choose, plus the full product.

The Impact 

In addition to immigrants learning English, this product is useful for:


native English-speaking adults who feel they never learned to read right
middle or high schoolers who have an IEP/are struggling readers


ESL students anywhere in the world (English is a world language!)

I believe the product would also be useful for children learning to read for the first time, and once the adult product is ready, I plan to move on to the child version.
By supporting this product, you will make it possible for teachers and learners of English to save countless hours of time.  Saving any amount of time in learning to read English will:

get immigrants to a paying job faster


reduce the amount of time and funding needed for Special Education and students with an IEP
reduce the time/money required to teach English in the developing world
once the child product is ready, the time saved in teaching reading can be used to increase math/science education, to improve the international rankings of the U.S.

While this is my first Indiegogo venture, I am familiar with completing big projects successfully, in particular researching and writing my 275-page dissertation, and the 2011 volume on the Acquisition of German that I coauthored with Martha Young-Scholten (culmination of years of research on the topic).  I am also a critical member of a big research project on Adult Second Language Acquisition of English at Newcastle University (England) run by my coauthor Martha Young-Scholten.  (Check my Wikipedia page on Organic Grammar!)
Risks & Challenges

 This is ultimately a huge project, with far-reaching ramifications.  
The main challenge would be giving up before reaping the benefits.  I feel so strongly about my approach, though, that I believe that one way or another I will get the adult version finished, and accessible to teachers. (One of my motives was to give back to society while working on something closely related to my passion, Linguistics.)
The other main challenge is getting my web page into a shape that will work well, including international versions.  I am planning to work on this after getting the product finished.
Finally, any money that I am able to make through the web page would go into making a child version of the product that K-2 elementary school teachers could use in teaching reading for the first time.
Other Ways You Can Help
 If you cannot help at this time, please let someone who might be interested know about my campaign!  (Use Indiegogo share tools)  Also, check out my webpage http://theverbcompany.net.

story:
What 

KMD's test can determine the presence and monitor the progression of cancer using a simple urine sample.

KMD Biomarker Diagnostics has developed a test to analyze metabolic profiles of urine and deliver accurate, early-stage detection of breast cancer. 

This method allows us to detect breast cancer non-invasively and painlessly with almost no false positives or negatives and at an earlier stage than existing methods.


KMD will donate 50% of all future royalties

We have commited to donate no less than 50% of any future profits and royalties from the breast cancer test we develop with funding from this campaign back to breast cancer research and prevention.

Who We Are

Martin N. Martinov, PhD

Nick Kaludov, PhD

Dejan Nenov

Martin is our chief scientist and the inventor of the math algorithms behind the KMD Bio models. His work at the intersection of quantum physics, chemistry and biology has been published in peer reviewed scientific journals. He collaborates with premier research organizations like Johns Hopkins University.

Nick is our chromatography expert and another bio-scientist. While at NIH, he patented a chromatography purification method for gene therapy vectors that was licensed for commercial applciations. Nick manages the collection of urine samples, develops and runs our gas chromatography protocols that produce the data needed to execute the KMD tests.


Martin and Nick’s past projects have been funded by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, the Michael J Fox Foundation for Parkinson's Research and by the National Institutes of Health. Their most recent research was in the area of infectious diseases (malaria, sleeping sickness) and mental health (neurodegeneration, schizophrenia).

Dejan is a tech geek and our acting CEO. He does the easy stuff – power point, excel, a little fundraising. In his consulting work Dejan helps startups build new software and electronics hardware products. In January of this year his clients won two best of show and three honorable mentions at the 2015 CES International Computer and Electronics Show in Las Vegas. Dejan is also an active and dedicated member of the world-wide UWC alumni organization.

Martin & Nick - our scientists, have exceptionally broad experience in developing and applying computational methods to life sciences and drug discovery problems. Some of the projects that Martin and Nick have led are:

Why Are We Fundraising?

The funds that we raise will be used to:

  • Purchase several hundred urine  samples from patients diagnosed with breast cancer and dozens of samples from other cancers, as well as some “healthy” control samples. The samples are used to help us accurately and specifically classify breast cancer patients.
  • Process the samples to generate a complete metabolic data profile of each sample. These data profiles are used to create a mathematical model corresponding to a “disease fingerprint” of breast cancer, which accurately identifies breast cancer patients from patients afflicted with other types of cancer and disease-free individuals.
  • Run a blind clinical trial to independently confirm our results. We are presently working with St. Luke's Mountain States Tumor Institute (MSTI) in Boise, Idaho. 

As scientists-entrepreneurs, we see our time as a necessary investment. The funds will only be used towards buying and processing the urine samples and a few ancillary expenses (such as shipping). We guarantee $0.95 of every donated dollar will go directly towards sample acquisition and processing. These funds will not be used to pay ourselves salaries or living expenses.

To date, KMD Bio has been completely self-funded. This campaign is the first time we are reaching out asking for other people’s money. We are doing this, because without additional funds it will take us several years to gather and analyze the urine samples we need. 


With your help and contributions we will be able to develop the test in 6 to 9 months.

We chose crowdfunding over traditional private equity and venture funding paths, because in the early stage of development, we want to have the scientific and professional liberty to develop the technology without an overriding pressure to maximize profits.

When completed (we hope to be done in less than a year), KMD will license the breast cancer test to any company that commits to make it commercially available. We will make sure that our test is not just acquired and buried to prevent it from competing with existing products.

Why KMD Bio's Method?

Advanced surgical techniques and targeted therapies offer the possibility that cancer may one day become a manageable disease. But this will only be possible if the cancer is detected early in its course while it is still treatable.

Unfortunately, truly early detection remains elusive for many malignancies. For example, a typical breast cancer patient has had the disease for a decade by the time of diagnosis, due to mammography’s 70% sensitivity rate. Although magnetic resonance imaging is more sensitive and detects breast lesions much earlier than mammography, it is often prohibited by high costs and lack of availability. High false positive and false negative diagnosis further complicates therapy decisions or lead to unnecessary invasive procedures at an annual cost of over 4 billion dollars.

Our new, sensitive and specific non-invasive cancer diagnostic fingerprint, based on a person’s urine, is able to pick up the cancer early, before the patient has developed any symptoms and before current state of the art diagnostic tests can detect it. It also is able to distinguish between different cancer stages (i.e. stage I vs stage III or stage IV), adding needed information to further treatment options. This will have tremendous impact on survival rates and healthcare costs.

The hard science work done at the Scripps Center for Matabolomics is a direct validation of the KMD Metabolomics and Bioinformatics approach. 

Here is a fascinating, albeit rather technical publication showcasing the work our colleagues are doing:

http://masspec.scripps.edu/publications/public_pdf/Bioinformatics.pdf

KMD Bio’s ability to detect early and accurately diagnose breast cancer with a single sample from a patient will revolutionize our approach to healthcare by incorporating cost-effective and health-effective preventive measures and offering personalized recommendations based on individual patients’ needs and preferences.

Thank you for your support!

Thank you for your support!

story:
About Us:

The African American Music Association, Inc. (AAMA) was established to preserve, protect, promote and to foster the continued development of African American music and the legacy of those who compose, record and perform the music. The AAMA is a tax-exempt, 501(c) (3) entity. It is organized exclusively for charitable, cultural and educational purposes. Its primary goal is to offer programs and activities to the community that will assure a better quality of life for persons pursuing performing arts as a career or a vocation. The “total well-being” of the artist, through human and personal development is the overall goal.

The AAMA made it possible for many local performing artists to display their talents through concerts, street festivals, talent shows, and various other kinds of community-based cultural arts activities. 

Some of the projects that the AAMA produce and facilitate in the District of Columbia include:

Corporate Neighborhood Youth Project - The Corporate Neighborhood Youth Project specifically targets youth and families who live in Ward 7 & 8, and extends a solution based program of advocacy, health promotions, counseling, social and emotional development that will produce a cadre of young people who are conscious, community-oriented, responsible and accountable as leaders for the next generation.  A production of a musical CD with positive reinforcing lyrics is the capstone product produced from this youth development program using music and the arts to attract challenged and disadvantaged youth for positive change and advocates of the same.

The Annual Marvin Gay Day Celebration – This event consists of a proclamation by the Mayor of Washington, resolution acknowledgement by the DC City Council, the awarding of an Outstanding Community Service Award and a music concert by a local music group.

“Save the Children” Music Festival – This project serves as an activity that allows performing artists of all ages to come together for the purpose of offering their talents to promote the effort of saving our children from abuse, neglect and street violence.

Business of the Arts Workshop – This activity brings music professionals and other professionals together to serve as panelists in an educational and informational workshop setting. 

Artist Development Program - AAMA Artist Development Program is designed to educate the youth to the Business of Music, which include:  Entrepreneurship, Principles of Success,  Principles of Negotiation, Employ-ability Skills Development, Hands on training in production studio, Marketing & Promotions, Business Development & Business Plan Writing, Time Management and more...

Youth Tutoring and Mentoring Programs  – This programs tutors young boys and girls who are challenged with basic math, spelling and English lessons in school.  This is an after school program that benefits many youth.  We also mentor young boys and girls who are minors and need additional support.  We also offer self-image and self-esteem development for young males and females.

Computer Literacy Lab/Program – This program seeks to eradicate computer illiteracy from the community.  We plan to have classes for youth, teens, adults and senior citizens.  Our training takes the students from learning the keyboard, to learning word processing and mastering surfing and researching on the World Wide Web.

Back-to-work Readiness Program - This program teaches the students basic clerical office procedures, the principles of professionalism, proper office conduct and professional etiquette in a professional environment, etc.

For the last 30 years the African American Music Association has experienced great success providing community and youth development programs, events and opportunities to DC inner city youths.   Many of the youth that AAMA  have positively impacted have moved forward in life to experience a more positive and productive lifestyle.

 The AAMA is now in the process of an organizational restructuring and program revitalization.  We plan to continue to offer the above events and programs as we expand our programs and services to better support our constituency and the community.

What We Need:

AAMA is seeking to raise $2,000 within the next 30 days to complete the development of our new website  and marketing plan to more effectively publicize our events and youth and community development programs via the web.  The funds raised will be used solely for this purpose.

Our new website, which is under construction and that we are seeking crowdfunding support,  is a cutting edge multipurpose site, that will offer:  Online Event Management, Visitor Blog, Online Member Recruitment and Services, Online Donor and Sponsorship packages, E-commerce, Programs Area, Picture Gallery, as well as a historical documentary on each genre of music the African American music community created as a result of our sojourn, culture and experience in America.

Below is the links to our temporary website, and a link to the Homepage of AAMA's new website.

AAMA Temporary Website:  http://www.aamamusic.org
Coming Soon: 
AAMA New Website:  http://dev1.businessprodemo.com/AfricanAmerican...

The Impact

The AAMA has had a tremendous positive impact on transforming the lives of many DC  inner city youths.  Many of the youth that we have helped have moved forward to become productive members of their family, community and society.  Help us continue our work  of youth and community transformation using music  and the arts  as the tool to attract youth for positive change.

The Impact your funds will have:

  • Help AAMA set definite date of completion for the launch of the new website.
  • Help publicize our new program and services to reach more youth in the DMV area for positive change and development.
  • Strengthen AAMA professional image to better effectively market our organization to corporate sponsors and donors
  • Support our organizational mission to promote DC talent and continue to transform lives through our community and youth development programs and events.

Risks & Challenges

The AAMA site is being developed by a very professional and reputable web development company. Risks and Challenges are  minimal.  AAMA has already started the initial phase of the website production.  The remaining portion of the site has to deal with minor home page design changes and back-end coding of the database.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • Spread the word that AAMA is seeking Board Members with demonstrated experience and expertise in the following areas:  Fund Raising, Membership  Recruitment and Management, Marketing & Promotions, Meeting and Event Planning, Public Relations, Grant Writing and Production,
    • AAMA is seeking volunteers to support our revitalization efforts in the areas of:  administration,  program development, social media and web management, training, graphic design, street-team promotions...Please Contact Edward Tate  @ 202-304-2378.
    • If you cannot give at this time...please spread the word in the community about the Rebirth of the African American Music Association and ask a friend on our behalf to help us continue to help the youth and community.

story:
Short Summary

Nurses in the Middle East is a East and West Jerusalem-based registered non-profit organization devoted to promoting education and communal understanding of nurses in our region through conferences, catalyzing research opportunities, providing publication support, and promoting health in our communities. Our foundational belief is that nurses are the grassroots workers for communal health; and as such are the grassroots workers for peaceful, just societies. 

Our current campaign is to support a conference between East Jerusalem, the West Bank, and Jerusalem area nurses. The subject of the conference is "Across Borders: Long-Term Patient Follow Up between Israel and Palestine."

This conference will be the first of it's kind in Jerusalem, and has the potential to change the way nurses between the two lands communicate with each other after a patient has been moved over borders. The impact factor not only involves hundreds of nurses, but thousands of patients and their families who will benefit from a coordinated effort by Israeli and Palestinian nurses. Simultaneously, meeting, working together, and creating solutions for patient follow up will enable nurses to gain better understandings of each other on a social and political level. 

What We Need

In order to host this conference in East Jerusalem, we rely on the generosity of the international community to support our efforts, especially to keep costs low to our participants. 

The total cost of the conference, including a venue, technology, & materials, total $5,000. But in addition to the cost of the conference, we work with a unique audience. For many in Palestine, the cost of travel and the conference fee are too expensive to justify participating. Palestinian nurses have to take a day off of work in order to attend such conferences. They must leave early to insure crossing all borders, and work ahead of time to receive permissions to cross, which takes time and manpower on both sides of the border.

Since the involvement of all of the Israel/Palestine population is crucial to having successful solutions, Nurses in the Middle East offers scholarships to nurses which covers the conference fee, travel, and in some situations, accommodations. 

All funds raised will be used to cover the cost of conference logistics and provide scholarships to Palestinian nurses. 

The Impact

While this is our first conference for solely Israelis and Palestinians, our past regional Middle Eastern conferences have sextupled in size over the past 4 years. We grow in our capacity to provide publication support, with over 30 abstracts published from our most recent conference (February, 2015.) 

Beyond this, feedback from participants has discussed our secondary objective: to build understanding between people whose countries are in conflict with one another. Reports of co-research and authorship, a shift in perspective, and friendship have been sent days, weeks, and months after our conferences and workshops. 

As a East/West Jerusalem-based organization, we are thrilled to start working on the issues that most severely impact us- and this conference is our first step. 

Risks & Challenges

Living in a conflict zone, there are obstacles to our success. Ever-changing politics could result in border closures or threat to safety. 

In such a case, all funds raised would be reserved for our annual Middle Eastern Conference on Nursing and Caring, and would provide scholarships to Palestinian, Iranian, Jordanian, Bahrainian, Saudi Arabian, and other nationalities of nurses who face financial constraints that prevent their participation in such conferences.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot financially donate to our conference, please help us spread the word around the world! Email, Facebook, Twitter, and other social media platforms that bring donors to our indiegogo project are valid forms of actively working towards our common goal:

Nursing education, Cooperation, and Peace. 

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Short Summary Nurses in the Middle East is a East and West Jerusalem-based registered non-profit organization devoted to promoting education and communal understanding of nurses in our region through conferences, catalyzing research opportunities, providing publication support, and promoting health in our communities. Our foundational belief is that nurses are the grassroots workers for communal health; and as such are the grassroots workers for peaceful, just societies. 
Our current campaign is to support a conference between East Jerusalem, the West Bank, and Jerusalem area nurses. The subject of the conference is "Across Borders: Long-Term Patient Follow Up between Israel and Palestine."
This conference will be the first of it's kind in Jerusalem, and has the potential to change the way nurses between the two lands communicate with each other after a patient has been moved over borders. The impact factor not only involves hundreds of nurses, but thousands of patients and their families who will benefit from a coordinated effort by Israeli and Palestinian nurses. Simultaneously, meeting, working together, and creating solutions for patient follow up will enable nurses to gain better understandings of each other on a social and political level. 
What We Need
 In order to host this conference in East Jerusalem, we rely on the generosity of the international community to support our efforts, especially to keep costs low to our participants. 
The total cost of the conference, including a venue, technology, & materials, total $5,000. But in addition to the cost of the conference, we work with a unique audience. For many in Palestine, the cost of travel and the conference fee are too expensive to justify participating. Palestinian nurses have to take a day off of work in order to attend such conferences. They must leave early to insure crossing all borders, and work ahead of time to receive permissions to cross, which takes time and manpower on both sides of the border.
Since the involvement of all of the Israel/Palestine population is crucial to having successful solutions, Nurses in the Middle East offers scholarships to nurses which covers the conference fee, travel, and in some situations, accommodations. 
All funds raised will be used to cover the cost of conference logistics and provide scholarships to Palestinian nurses. 
    The Impact While this is our first conference for solely Israelis and Palestinians, our past regional Middle Eastern conferences have sextupled in size over the past 4 years. We grow in our capacity to provide publication support, with over 30 abstracts published from our most recent conference (February, 2015.) 
Beyond this, feedback from participants has discussed our secondary objective: to build understanding between people whose countries are in conflict with one another. Reports of co-research and authorship, a shift in perspective, and friendship have been sent days, weeks, and months after our conferences and workshops. 
As a East/West Jerusalem-based organization, we are thrilled to start working on the issues that most severely impact us- and this conference is our first step. 
    Risks & Challenges Living in a conflict zone, there are obstacles to our success. Ever-changing politics could result in border closures or threat to safety. 
In such a case, all funds raised would be reserved for our annual Middle Eastern Conference on Nursing and Caring, and would provide scholarships to Palestinian, Iranian, Jordanian, Bahrainian, Saudi Arabian, and other nationalities of nurses who face financial constraints that prevent their participation in such conferences.
    Other Ways You Can Help If you cannot financially donate to our conference, please help us spread the word around the world! Email, Facebook, Twitter, and other social media platforms that bring donors to our indiegogo project are valid forms of actively working towards our common goal:
Nursing education, Cooperation, and Peace. 
   And that's all there is to it.

story:
Textbooks — they’re usually heavy, boring, and expensive. In fact, the average textbook costs about $70. To buy every one of the approximately 14.7 million students that attended high school in 2014 just one textbook, it would take $1 billion.

We would like to bring that cost down as close to zero as possible.

All we need is money for the staff to pull it off. And speaking of staff, that could include you.


We want the textbook to be a publicly driven project. We're starting with an English/Literature textbook, but, if we raise more, we'll make more than one. (Hint, hint, wink, wink.)

We also want textbooks that are:

Digital/Printable — Whether you have a computer, or you want to print it out, we want it to accommodate your needs.

Customizable — We want to provide educators with the option of selecting only the pages they want/need. This way, if schools want to take the file to a printing company for an actual hardcover book, they can pay for only what they need.

Enjoyable — Textbooks can be a drag. We want a textbook that's as interactive as possible, one with current content, a modern feel, and — most importantly — humor.

Still reading? (We'll assume yes, but only because you're supposed to be doing something else.)

Here's what the process looks like.

Step 1 — Raise funds. (This is kind of important.)

Step 2 — Contact schools and educational administrators, and research criteria for textbooks. (We'll want to meet any required educational standards.)

Step 3 — Hire people. (This could include you!)

Here's what we'll potentially need:

  • Witty, Humorous Writers
  • Eagle Eye Editors
  • Engaging Artists
  • Sensible Public Relations Officers
  • Top Notch Graphic Designers
  • Modern, Creative Web Designers
  • Proficient Software Designers
  • Knowledgeable Lawyers/Attorneys

Step 4 — Start writing a rough draft to have ready by June 2016. (We're aiming to make a grade 9-12 textbook — in a year.)

Step 5 — Send out rough draft versions to students, educators, and administrators to praise or lambast.  (We have thick skin.)

Step 6 — Edit the books so that (almost) everyone is happy. (We don't want people falling asleep because of what they're reading.)

Step 7 — Finalize our outreach program. (The more schools that know, the better. Plus, we'll have a final product by this time.)

Step 8 — Release the book. (This should be ready by June 2017, because many educators lesson plan during the summer.)


1 — Donate a $1. Seriously. If every person donates just one dollar, we could create more than one textbook.

2 — Spread the word. There's a video at the top of this page you're free to share. Post this on your friends' walls, tweet directly to them, email it to them. They're more likely to do something if you contact them directly.

3 — Write about this project, or get someone you know to write about it, too. Bloggers and social media experts are perfect for this. They have audiences and those audiences help bring attention to the cause.

4 — Do all three of these things. We like overachievers.



If you're still reading by this point you're either (A) incredibly interested or (B) really avoiding your work. Either way, here are some questions that you might have and their accompanying answers.

Where does the money go?

It goes to paying people to write, edit, and design the book. Creating one textbook is expensive, but we're trying to make a grade 9-12 literature/English textbook here.

How can I get in on a potential opportunity for working on this project?

The easiest way to get noticed is to contribute to the project via a $10 perk. That option allows you to name drop yourself or someone else for a position. We'll also post updates about positions when we're hiring. Everyone is welcome to apply.

By giving to this project, we're looking to give back to people in the form of freelance work and, of course, sweet, sweet, dough.

What if you don't raise enough money?

Depending on how much we raise, we'll either (A) stash the money away in a secret lair and revisit our campaign strategy, (B) stay the course and use inventive techniques to complete the project, or (C) find out where you live, knock on your door while holding kittens and puppies with sad eyes, and ask you for money.

What if you raise more than you need?

Again, this depends on how much we raise. However, as a general rule, assume that for every $500,000 we raise, we'll try to create another free textbook, such as a core math or science class. Maybe we'll even create a few accompanying apps. If you have ideas and suggestions please let us know via Facebook or Twitter.

This campaign story is close to receiving a tl;dr title. What do you plan to do about that?

End it here.

story:
The beginning of Noble came from the vision to create more beauty, kindness, and promote Fair Trade and socially conscious consumption.

  

We opened a design store and after some time we closed its doors and with it we are no longer able to help families around Mexico to keep creating beautiful art, 100% handmade and with so much love and enthusiasm,  and bring new and interesting designs to the world. 
We need support to create an online store business now, with the right and proper marketing professional structure. This is a World-Class online training program but with heart and kindness too!!!! 
It is about creativity and keep supporting artisans. In order to do this I have to go and train myself to have a successful business model. I do not own any degrees or previous education. I had built a life and a business based on self learning and hard work. But because we need a solid foundation, created with heart too we need this training!


The funds go to: Enroll in a world-high class educational online marketing training with one of the top leaders on the field, Marie Forleo B*School

Once we take the business training we will provide the best assortment of Mexican products and designs online, connect communities to the source of their food and the farmers that grow it, offer delicious, honest food, support handcraft local communities creating beautiful items that mixed a contemporary look with traditional Mexican textiles techniques, among others.

We would love to be able to support Mexican beekeeper and farmers, local-organic cocoa producers; among others, trough commercializing their products as well as many exceptional artisans trough co-creating new handcraft designs with them.

We want to invest in directly supporting farming and artisan families meet their daily needs. 


OUR SUSTAINABLE BUSINESS PRACTICES:

  • We create convenient alternatives to commonly available commercial decorative items
  • We believe in fostering trust with all stakeholders, from suppliers to retailers to customers
  • We mitigate our environmental impact in production, packaging and operations
 

I truly desire with all my heart to be able to inspire others to live their creative dreams, but I am fully aware I have to start with myself so I can extend the knowledge, support and teach others to do the same in a near future...... this will be my pass away the LOVE big dream!


  • Art Love . after B*School we will keep investing on:

    • Mexican handmade traditional textiles from indigenous communities from different parts of the country.
    • Investment in certified and sustainable wood for the creation and fabrication of items that mixed the Mexican textiles with contemporary design.
    • Creating online resources and training tools for other self-creative entrepreneurs.

story:
Why Do We Want to Raise the $70,000 Goal?

We have developed our awesome version one website and mobile apps already.  We are now faced with the challenges of getting the product out into the market. 

 1.  Product Marketing

2.  Hiring College & University Brand Ambassadors

3.  Organizing Events. e.g. Campus events and Webinars

4.  Massive Social Media Campaigns.

5.  Advertisement

6. Development of collaborative tools to promote entrepreneurship among college students and university students as well as the fresh graduates.

7. Translate the platform into Spanish,French, Chinese and Hindi



The Story


Introducing FresHires: the innovative new job discovery and self branding platform dedicated to revolutionizing the way today’s young job seekers connect with career opportunities and build their futures.   

My name is Yinka. I am an Entrepreneur, Petro-Chemical Process Engineer and Business Analyst. I am passionate about Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics as well as the career development of the rising young professional. I have created the FresHires platform to help other rising young professionals who are going through a very tough time finding the perfect opportunity for their internships, part time or full time jobs after college graduation.

My Motivation      

The FresHires project was launched based on my personal experience. Having studied in the United States, England and Nigeria with 2 Master’s degrees (Petroleum Engineering from the UK and Chemical Engineering in the USA), I still could not get hired. Most companies would not even extend the opportunity to showcase the skills or experience I’ve had over the years either from the college environment or an internship. During this period, I was really disturbed and depressed. I started thinking more of being a solution than being part of the problem that arises from unemployment among rising young professionals. 

While I was waiting for the ‘perfect’ opportunity, I worked as a call center agent being paid about $8/hr for few months before the call center was shut down. This heightened my frustration as an Engineering graduate. I actually wrote to some Human resources department of different companies asking work in an unpaid volunteer position. Sadly, no one would oblige. I decided to travel down to Houston TX (the oil and gas city) to find a job. I interviewed with some companies, most of these companies would not send a response to explain the outcome of the interview. I called in severally and would be told not to contact them again, as they would send me a notification once decision was made. Up until this moment, I have not received a response. I spoke to a lot of people trying to find a job to know more about their personal experience and strangely, they were very similar to mine. 


The Turning Point        

At that moment, I decided something needed to be done to help people like me who were going through the same experience (Graduated College and no one would hire you either as an intern, volunteer or full time position). I got a job in Houston in a large apparel, hunting and fishing store, unloading trucks and stocking shelves. Honestly, I would relish an opportunity to work for any engineering firm even if I would be paid the same rate I was being paid for stocking up footwear on shelves.    

I called up my friend -Olu, whom I've known for 14 years (now FresHires Co-founder) to share the FresHires idea with him knowing that he had been in a similar predicament a few years earlier. We decided to put our hearts to work and create a platform to change the face of hiring of college students, university students, fresh graduates with little or no work experience as well as professionals with some experience looking to change jobs.

Companies hire not solely based on work experience but also because of GREAT SKILLS. Great skills that proffer solutions to company needs exemplify our self brand and this is exactly what FresHires is all about.

Job search platforms are nothing new, of course: but from LinkedIn to Internmatch, today’s job search platforms fall short of the mark when it comes to equipping today’s highly educated, qualified and motivated young job seekers with the tools and opportunities they need to make the leap from the sheltered world of school to the wide world of career and professional development.  

FresHires is here to change the career development game once and for all. Combining everything from self-branding and networking to mentoring and career guidance to job search and job match into one streamlined platform, FresHires is paving the way to the future for job seekers around the world.

Here's a quick overview of just a few of the features that make FresHires unlike any career development platform available today: 

Brand Yourself 
FresHires allows our users to showcase their individual brands, unque skills, talents and abilities with dynamic, engaging multi-media profiles that integrate images, video and narrative elements. 

Get Connected - and Stay Connected 
FresHires combines social, academic and professional networking into onestreamlined environment, so users can stay plugged into their social media life while developing meaningful relationships and professional skills at the same time. 

Get Seen, Get Hired 
With students and graduates showcasing their unique skills and branding themselves with our unique multi-media profiles, recruiters and prospective employers can then browse job seekers' profiles and see at a glance what that person will bring to their team. 

​

FresHires Job Board
The FresHires Job Board is where recruiters and companies of all shapes and sizes can post jobs specifically suited to students, interns, graduates and young professionals just starting out on their career journey.

Volunteer Opportunities
FresHIres also features a volunteer job board where  businesses can support and promote volunteer jobs that give rising young professionals the chance to build their resumes and their communities at the same time. 

​

FresHires Network
FresHires is the ultimate community for young job seekers. Students and graduates can interact, connect and develop relationships that matter. The FresHires network also includes mentors, counselors, educators, life coaches, career coaches, recruiters and companies that can provide young job seekers with invaluable advice that will help them on their road to career success.            

Dedicated Chat Rooms
Our network of mentors, counselors, educators, life coaches, career coaches, recruiters and companies utilize our dedicated chat rooms to host personal, private interactions with our students and graduates, both in groups and one-on-one. Students and graduates can also create customized chat rooms on academic topics or events happening on their campuses and in their communities. 


Mobile App Portfolio

FresHires is still in the early stages of development -- like our users are in the early stage sof their career. But like with our users, all signs point to bigger and better things to come! 

Development of the FresHires mobile app for smartphone and other mobile devices is well underway. This will give users the chance to update their profile wherever and whenever they are. 

 



Our strategy/approach: 

To work directly with college/university career center to help with campaigning FresHires to both students and alumni community by participating in career fairs. We plan to give internship and paid employment opportunities to current college students who would serve as college ambassador for FresHires in their respective schools. These FresHires ambassadors would serve as point of contact and provide information and assistance to other students who are seeking to know about FresHires and also require support to use the platform. The ideal FresHires ambassadors would be a student who is interested in technology, meeting people, and helping people use technology to achieve something of value.  We would pay our ambassadors from the funds that we raise.  We hope to be able to hire students from different colleges and universities and provide them valuable work experience that would come in handy on their FresHires Academic Portfolio and Personal Resumes.


Risks and challenges

We have been bootstrapping this project since June 2013. Inadequate resources and funding has hindered us from being able to deliver this project as fast as we wanted. Despite the fact, that we have been running this project by the two of us for a very long time, we have built two prototype versions of this website and now we are almost perfecting the version 1.0 of the main website and that of the mobile app which we will like to make available for free downloads in Google and iTunes Stores by May 2015.

We desire to reach over 22 Million college and university students in the United States of America and this can only be achieved through adequate resources. Our goal is to hire college students on-campus to work for the FresHires Corporation as brand ambassadors, We believe the opportunity to work for our company will be a great step forward in helping these rising young professionals gain work experience.

We still have about 5 new features to add to our web and app products that will immensely impact the FresHires online community of students, graduates, recruiters,life coaches, career coaches, educators, counselors and companies. We can not add these features yet due to inadequate funds.

We sincerely hope that this crowdfunding process will help us bring to life the products and services that will help make our world a better place for all of us.


Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us share our fundraising link on you social media accounts.  Kindly Help Spread the word among students, professors, counselors, mentors, life coaches, career coaches, company executives, recruiters and parents.

Also, you can help us out by using Paypal as your form of payment for those that have a Paypal account. This will reduce service charges on the total amount contributed. Thanks.

Like us on Facebook

Follow us on Twitter

FresHires NetworkFresHires is the ultimate community for young job seekers. Students and graduates can interact, connect and develop relationships that matter. The FresHires network also includes mentors, counselors, educators, life coaches, career coaches, recruiters and companies that can provide young job seekers with invaluable advice that will help them on their road to career success.            
Dedicated Chat RoomsOur network of mentors, counselors, educators, life coaches, career coaches, recruiters and companies utilize our dedicated chat rooms to host personal, private interactions with our students and graduates, both in groups and one-on-one. Students and graduates can also create customized chat rooms on academic topics or events happening on their campuses and in their communities. 


Mobile App Portfolio
FresHires is still in the early stages of development -- like our users are in the early stage sof their career. But like with our users, all signs point to bigger and better things to come! 
Development of the FresHires mobile app for smartphone and other mobile devices is well underway. This will give users the chance to update their profile wherever and whenever they are. 
 





Our strategy/approach: 
To
 work directly with college/university career center to help with 
campaigning FresHires to both students and alumni community by 
participating in career fairs. We plan to give internship and paid 
employment opportunities to current college students who would serve as 
college ambassador for FresHires in their respective schools. These 
FresHires ambassadors would serve as point of contact and provide 
information and assistance to other students who are seeking to know 
about FresHires and also require support to use the platform. The ideal 
FresHires ambassadors would be a student who is interested in 
technology, meeting people, and helping people use technology to achieve
 something of value.  We would pay our ambassadors from the funds that 
we raise.  We hope to be able to hire students from different colleges 
and universities and provide them valuable work experience that would 
come in handy on their FresHires Academic Portfolio and Personal 
Resumes.






Risks and challenges

We
 have been bootstrapping this project since June 2013. Inadequate 
resources and funding has hindered us from being able to deliver this 
project as fast as we wanted. Despite the fact, that we have been 
running this project by the two of us for a very long time, we have 
built two prototype versions of this website and now we are almost 
perfecting the version 1.0 of the main website and that of the mobile 
app which we will like to make available for free downloads in Google 
and iTunes Stores by May 2015.
We
 desire to reach over 22 Million college and university students in the 
United States of America and this can only be achieved through adequate 
resources. Our goal is to hire college students on-campus to work for 
the FresHires Corporation as brand ambassadors, We believe the 
opportunity to work for our company will be a great step forward in 
helping these rising young professionals gain work experience.
We
 still have about 5 new features to add to our web and app products that
 will immensely impact the FresHires online community of students, 
graduates, recruiters,life coaches, career coaches, educators, 
counselors and companies. We can not add these features yet due to 
inadequate funds.
We
 sincerely hope that this crowdfunding process will help us bring to 
life the products and services that will help make our world a better 
place for all of us.


    Other Ways You Can Help You can help us share our fundraising link on you social media accounts.  Kindly Help Spread the word among students, professors, counselors, mentors, life coaches, career coaches, company executives, recruiters and parents.

Also, you can help us out by using Paypal as your form of payment for those that have a Paypal account. This will reduce service charges on the total amount contributed. Thanks.
Like us on Facebook
Follow us on Twitter

story:
Remember your college visits? Remember how important and exciting those trips were? Help Fenway give our students this valuable experience so they have the information needed to make informed decisions about their next step beyond Fenway! 


Who We Are

Fenway High School is a Pilot School of the Boston Public Schools.  The student body is diverse, reflecting the academic and demographic profile of the Boston Public School system as a whole. The majority of our students come from low-income familes, and close to one-third come from homes where English is not the primary language. Many arrive having struggled academically at previous schools.

Fenway's young men's group is planning to spend a week on an out-of-state tour of colleges and universities, with a focus on Historically Black Colleges and Universities.  The trip is part of Fenway High School's effort to address the national issue of chronic low achievement for young males of color who graduate at numbers far below their white counterparts.  Past institutions visited have included Howard University, Bowie State University, Lincoln University, and Hampton University.

This trip provides our students with opportunities they might not otherwise have.  When our students - many of whom will be the first in their families to attend college - visit campuses and begin to picture themselves as college students, they realize that higher education is an attainable dream for them.

What We Need

We are raising funds to bring a group of 20 young men of color on a college tour.  The trip will cost $9,000, or $450 per student.

The Impact

In spite of the challenges many of our students face, they have found increasing success over the years.  Last year, 100% of Fenway's graduating seniors were admitted to college, with 68% attending four-year institutions.  Their success is due in large part to initiatives like college visits.  Walking the campus of an Historically Black College and University and seeing students, professors, and administrators of color helps these young men envision themselves as college students.

story:
Hi! My name is Laura Cardoza Ramírez and I am a 9th grade student. I won a scholarship to study at Les Tapies Summer Visual Arts Programs from June 28 through July 18 this year in Southern France. The scholarship covers full tuition plus room and board. However, I need to fund my own travel expenses. I won the scholarship through an essay contest that I was hesitant to participate in because I was not sure if I could fund my way to France, but my parents encouraged me and told me that if I got it, we would find the way. So, this is the way that I am trying to help my family get my airplane ticket. The money I ask for will cover traveling to Lyon as an unaccompanied minor, pocket money and other expenses and the cost of the fundraiser campaign (perks + indiegogo fee). I want to give something back to those who want to help me, so I decided to use indiegogo because it lets me do perks. The perks are my original photographs, printed and signed, which you can select from my flickr page.

I really thank you for any help you can give me to take the program. I am considering studying arts and design and this will be a very helpful experience for me.

¡Hola! Me llamo Laura Cardoza Ramírez y estoy en noveno grado. Me gané una beca en una competencia de ensayo escrito para el programa de artes visuales de Les Tapies en Francia. La beca incluye todo menos el pasaje y por eso estoy tratando de conseguir los fondos para mi pasaje por indiegogo. El dinero de mi meta es para cubrir el pasaje, gastos personales y las cuotas de indiegogo, además de las fotos que son parte de los perks que recibirán los que me ayuden con dinero para mi pasaje. Quiero dar algo a cambio por su ayuda, así que les ofezco mis fotos originales impresas y firmadas, que pueden seleccionar de mi página de flickr.

Muchas gracias por cualquier ayuda que me puedan dar, estoy considerando estudiar arte y diseño y este verano puede ayudarme mucho.

story:
It is estimated that around 10 million children in sub-Saharan Africa  drop out of school every year. One of the major reasons is because their families cannot afford to pay for their education. We are here to create a change and assist every rural child to stay in school, but we need you.

I am an undergraduate freshman at EARTH University Costa Rica (http://www.earth.ac.cr/). I was born and raised in Kenya, in a fishing community along the northeastern shores of Lake Victoria where poverty, illiteracy and a yearning for a better life dominates. I am the first person ever to go through high school and graduate with university entry points. However, this was not an easy pursuit because my family could not pay for my college education, just as they could not pay for my high school education. In high school my education was primarily funded by bursaries, grants and well-wishers. Unfortunately, it was difficult to find college aid. Four years after my graduation I was blessed to win a MasterCard Foundation Scholarship to study at EARTH University. Knowing someone believed in me was an amazing feeling.


The rate of school dropouts in my community falls above 60% for every group of students that start schooling together. The factors contributing to this are primarily caused by the unfriendly conditions my community holds. With every family living below the poverty line, no one is able to afford the school fees when their children enroll in high schools. Additionally, the poor learning environment perpetuates the cycle of poor performance.  

When I received my scholarship last May, I was doing voluntary tutoring in my community’s primary school. Since everyone in my community dreams of studying abroad, I used my story to encourage the students to see the opportunities and potential they too hold.

Because of this, 20 students graduated with very good grades from the primary school and were all admitted to high school.Most of these students are being forced out of school because of outstanding school fee balances.They are the change in this community and they have shown an incredible motivation, determination and burning energy to be different by going to school instead of going to the lake to fish. My primary goal is to provide them with the opportunity to be the change my community has been so desperate for.

The magnitude of impact Education can provide for my community is immeasurable. Educating a child in a community dominated by illiteracy, poverty, ignorance, HIV/AIDS, teen pregnancies, poor sanitation and sewage systems, can start the cycle of change. I want to be this catalyst for change in a community that means so much to me. Educating children in such a poverty-ridden community creates a positive effect far beyond the children directly helped. With your help, a hope is built, a new horizon of opportunity is created for the children and the community, a change to a better world begins.



The Initiative


EducationHOPE is an initiative created by two students at EARTH University student with support from two school directors, with the aim of giving back to their communities and and helping extend resources and opportunities to other communities just as they have been privileged to get them at EARTH, and impact many other more lives. Being from very financially devastated social backgrounds, the students have faced substantive obstacles to achieve their dreams of getting education and their struggle is the call they have had to remember the communities. They are all from rural villages where poverty and its related problems are so dominant. That is why many children born from these communities don´t get to school and if they do, they drop out so soon. They want to show possibility and enable dreams.


What We Need & What We Get

With this campaign, we wish to begin by helping 20 students from a village located around the Lake Victoria region in Western Kenya. The students, already enrolled in high school, need $600 every year to stay in school. 

This is why we need you.

 With $600, every child gets all that he needs to stay in school for a whole year without the stress of being sent out of school. This will include;

            ·School tuition for the year

             ·Accommodation in the school residences for the year

             · Food

             · Books and revision materials

             · A little monthly stipend

Your support is important to these students.

We intend to directly send all the money raised to the school account in collaboration with the school principal. We believe all donations are relevant, therefore, all money will be sent whether or not our goal is met. 


Why is Your Contribution Important?

The community we are working to change is one that has had a very negative school enrollment and very huge numbers of dropouts. In fact, only one has managed to get into the university (David, the founder EducationHOPE). Among the factors, the main one is the poverty levels that are so high in this community, literally every household lives on less than $1 every day. So many students cannot go to school because their families cannot afford to pay their school fees, a necessity since education has to be paid for by students in Kenyan high schools.


Imagine the impact you are creating not only for the students but for their families and also their communities. Educating one child can change the world, but you are going beyond this with your support to create a motivation, show a possibility and beyond all this, building a future for someone whom without you cannot make it.

With your support, these students will forget the trouble and worry of being sent out of school and instead peacefully stay in school just like their fellow students.

Help us make the difference


The Story. 

About Majimbo

Majimbo, a little island located in the northeastern part of Lake Victoria in the western part of Kenya just next to Uganda is approximately 5km2. In a distance, beauty shines to its maximum. In fact it is one of the best places to watch the breathtaking scenery of sunsets in the Western horizon in Kenya; the reflection of the burning skies by the Lake in the evenings presents an amazement of nature. It is one of these regions on earth with some of the best smiles I have ever seen in my life.

Despite the abundance of life of nature in Majimbo, an agony is rooted deep in the lifestyles of the people it hosts. Within this hidden beauty, a hidden story lies. Stories of great yearning and need although in ignorance, a life lived without a hope of a tomorrow although a knowledge of its existence. A daily life with no electricity, no cars or motorbikes, no clean water, no system for waste and sewage (which crazily pollutes the water where their livelihood, the tilapia and the Nile perch, comes from), there is no trust in one another, no shoes, no lunches and no decent clothes for the kids, they wear some dirty and ready-to-retire uniforms that have been in circulation for longer than the wildly fluctuating Kenyan Shilling. Shacks are built of manure or corrugated iron sheets and randomly found-and-resurrected bits and bobs. There are about two bicycles (from a different century), dirt tracks that get flooded and impossible to go through after a big rain, there is HIV left and right, polygamy and widow-inheritance which, of course plays the biggest role in the spread of HIV, there are qualified but frustrated and unmotivated teachers who will wonder for the rest of their days why they spent so much money and time on college when they will never make it back unless they become headmasters and will be in the position to play with government and charity money.  (Imagine the impact of this on educating the kids). There are some wild ideas on life and existence, there are some very unusual beliefs, rituals, customs (some of which only contribute to the health issues), there is no motivation, there are no ideas or inspiration and if there is a spark of inspiration, there is no one to implement the ideas. Most people dream only about simple survival. Imagination is nearly dead. Everything stands still, frozen in time.

Each day passes and as time goes the exact definition of Majimbo´s contents of life rarely defines itself; for of reality, a harsher condition of life continues to dominate. On average seven out of ten students who enroll in the community primary school drop out before graduating, and out of those who graduate, very few of them join high schools due to poor performances and the incapacity to afford high school education... None of the girls in this community are educated. They either drop out of school as young as 15 to get married to fellow teens who are dropouts too or get pregnant somewhere on the way before reaching grade 8. Without education, a future is not created, a community is under extinction and this is what this community faces. Among these factors, comes HIV/AIDS which has impacted this community so negatively; ranging from reduced labor to loss of lives each time. Not ignoring the agony of this deadly disease, the people contribute to its spread although in ignorance but in the name of cultural practice and customs which illiteracy highly contributes to. Widow inheritance, polygamy and not observing AIDS prevention mechanisms especially with self-care in matrimonial lives.  The effects of these factors and the disease itself continue to live in this community and possibly forever if something is not done. I would take a moment to imagine 10 years from now and think about all the 10-15 year old children, if we do not take them to school, this is the lifestyle they will be living; all will be married with at least two children or two wives or would have married more than two wives of whom they will be living with none of them. This means that at least 60% of them to more than 70% of the youths in Majimbo today will have HIV/AIDS. They will also be working so hard fishing in the dangerous Lake Victoria to feed their families. If the reverse happens and all of them go to school, maybe only a few of them will be married, the probability that any of them will be HIV/AIDS positive will be highly reduced, none of them will be in the lake fishing but rather in school looking for opportunities and possibly just as I do, at least some of them will be out there in the world looking for opportunities for this community to make it better.

Out of Majimbo this year something unusual happened, it is surprising! Since when I got out of high school in 2011, only two have been admitted after me. All who have managed to graduate from high school after me did not join high school, either for financial or performance reasons. This year more than 20 students performed well and were admitted to high schools. This in a very great manner was contributed to by the motivation I gave the students while in school, after winning a MasterCard Foundation Scholarship to study abroad. Out of those who graduated with good grades are two girls who because they could not afford their school, one decided to run away from her home and get married while the other is now pregnant; both aren´t in school. The rest of the students who are now all admitted to Got Agulu Secondary School, the nearest high school in Majimbo has one major worry; how they will be able to stay in school until they graduate and how will they achieve their dreams after this long struggle. The bottom-line is the amazing motivation they have had to generate to overcome the demanding and harsh conditions to graduate from primary school with good marks and grades. This is reason enough to paint the picture of the kind of determination and passion in the minds of each of these students. They are all from very poor family backgrounds with some of them being orphans while others literally have to also work with their parents to enable them to at least get a single meal in a day. By this, they literally have not enough time to study as day-scholars and with the conditions, a number of them are forced to miss even school. Already, even after only staying in school for two months, most of them have been forced to stay out of school because of the huge outstanding fee balances they already have yet their families cannot afford to pay. These students represent an array of diversity and varied conditions that although related are very different. 


Sample Stories

Edward Mahala

16-year-old Edward Mahala is the only child of a young couple who died just six years after the birth of their son. The couple who later died of HIV/AIDS after the young Edward was able to walk around the yard and enjoy the life of every toddler luckily did not infect their baby with the disease but the effect of their absence was felt just immediately after the father who died a year after the mother was just taken back to the soil. No one despite knowing the real need the young innocent Edward needed was ready to take him in to take care of him; the reason being the huge stigma this deadly disease held at that time. Indeed the grandmother with whom he lives today says that not even his uncles were ready to hear his story, they would literally evade it if they had to hear the name Edward. The poor little Edward was too innocent even to guess this. Two days later after all the people were to get back to their homes as the Luo culture demands after the burial of the dead, the grandmother took the little boy. She did not know how she was going to take care of him although she says she was in love with the angel after no one else was ready. She does not have a husband and two of her children are also suffering from this deadly disease. She did not have a job but largely depended on the help from the elder son who owns a boat at the lake. She was ready to share the little help she would always receive. Edward has since then grown into a boy ready to make her grandmother proud but still he cannot pay his school fees, neither can his grandmother.

John Maduri


From a very early stage in his life, he was outstanding and his level of curiosity would make him stand out. Now, he wants to be a doctor but what is so attractive about John is his friendliness and ability to build cohesion with new people of all kinds. During his stay in his primary school, every teacher was impressed with his ability to lead, discipline and level of maturity even at that young age.

John is a fourteen-year-old boy from a very humble background. His father who is now 87 years old never had an opportunity to even go midway through the elementary school and neither did the mother have an opportunity to step into the elementary school class. Subsequently, never did his parents make any savings for him or for his two elder brothers to take them to school. With his good performance, he received an admission to one of the provincial schools in the region but because of financial problems he could not get in but went to the cheaper school near home where he could stay as a day-scholar.

John has two brothers, the elder who after doing his high school exams did not do very well and seven years later still does not have a job. The other just got a scholarship to study outside the country after having taken his exam in 2011. John really needs to be in school as he dreams to build his parents a good life but yet faces a lot of challenges to pay his fees as none of his parents can work.

Nicholas Lwande

Nicholas is the first born of a very young couple who live on donated land so far apart separated from their ancestral home. His grandfather separated from what they call a family and so they are today. Neither of his parents ever went to school and they get their daily bread from fishing which in reality no longer has value in Majimbo. From the early stages in their lives Nicholas and his other five siblings have had to miss school to fish and also in a manner take part in the maintenance of the family. Even before starting school, Nicholas was a ¨professional¨ when it comes to fishing as he would always accompany his father any moment the mother was not in a position to do so. This has made him and his siblings miss a lot of days in school. None of his parents take the education of the children serious and the motivation that each of the children has is what keeps them moving along the academic path. In fact, one of his cousins already dropped out of school to help in the family upkeep while the brother had to repeat grade 8 this year because the parents could not afford to pay for their studies.

This boy has a unique dream. In fact, judging from the family conditions he has grown up from he would not even know of surgery but when asked what he wants to be, he says he wants to study to become a surgeon and help those people who want operations.


Dennis Ogilo

Dennis is an embodiment of an incredible possibility and indeed a representation of defying the odds. With all the generations of his family, he is the first of the family to get into a high school despite being an orphan. Indeed, none of the family members has ever taken the primary national exams but all dropout at the fifth or sixth grade to get into the Lake. Every male in the family of Dennis is a fisherman from the grandparents and so amazingly Dennis has broken this cycle so uniquely.

Dennis is one person you would conclude is completely intelligent. Being an orphan and living with one of the uncles, he has to go fishing just like the other members in the family hence missing school on a regular basis and despite that he still managed being among the best students. Literally, there is no one who is going to pay for his education despite his moving determination and brightness. He is among those whom I call a motivation despite having gone through the same environment just because the energy that he carries is an incredible one.


Challenges

We believe that being a believer in education and a creator of hope for a rural child, you deserve an updated information on how those whom you support are advancing towards their dreams, we know the best way to keep you updated is through having a website where you can visit any moment or have email newsletters. We are in the process of making our website since we intend to impact the lives of many other children through your support not only in Majimbo but all through Africa and when the website is done later this year, we will keep you all updated.


Other Ways You Can Help

The success of this needs you in all the following ways.

You have some friends, family members who may help bring hope to the rural poor children? Share with them through personal emails.

You have classmates who have seen the importance and fruits of being a class? They too may want to help others sit in a classroom and change their lives.

You have colleagues who have seen the sweet fruits of education? They will definitely be interested in sharing the hope and help many others experience it. Share the word

Use the indiegogo share tools like Facebook, Twitter to reach out to friends, write a blog or use Google+ about this and get the word going.

You can like us on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/ruralkidhope to get updates on all the information regarding the impact you have made.

Thank you very much for being part of this and being part of the campaign to create a better future in the rural Africa.
